v0YSQe5qOFy7FnUsbx-O9Q.text: Wanna talk about asian soul food? Try the beef stew at Pho Saigon 8. OMG its soo thick, rich, and hearty. It comes served with either french bread, rice, and noodles but my bf and i will always order all three LOL. its way too good to even waste a single drop.   Okay enough with the obsessiveness. I have been to many pho shops in las vegas, little saigon, pho kim long, pho so 1 and it seems like the beef stew always comes out as beef soup. Its flavorless, oily, and watery. At pho saigon 8, you can tell the broth gets its richness from the cubes of beef and tendon and the sweetness from the onions and the carrots boiling for many hours. Since this location has opened, either one of us always orders this dish. But as usual the pho-, bun-, and the plate dishes are exceptional. The only reason why I give this place 4 and not 5 stars is because of the customer service, the waitress sat us at a dirty and sticky table and the server next came to refill our water. If you look at a typical asian family,  it seems like we care mainly about the taste/ quality of food only and less the customer service aspect. We have this 'dont bother me, dont check on me unless if i ask' kinda thing. But wiping down tables, and refilling water should be a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried crepe with shrimp and bean sprout ( appetizer )
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef strew with rice noodle

1hcXp-IczKOr3Z7spivhzw.text: When I lived in Vegas, this was my go-to place for a good bowl of pho. I lived alone at the time, so I rarely ever cooked pho at home since a pot of it can feed a dozen people. Vietnamese food has come a long way since I moved there in 2006. Pho Saigon 8 is one of the best in town. The broth is clear and flavorful, made with just the right amount of each ingredient. Some places botch the soup by adding too much of a certain ingredient. Clarity is a good indication of the quality of a pho broth. If it's cloudy, it's probably no bueno.   Besides the pho, the other dish I usually order here is the Hu Tieu My Tho with the soup on the side. I love Hu Tieu, probably even more than Pho, and this place has the best in town. Nothing compared to my hometown favorites (Nam Vang & Da Lat), but it's the best thing I can eat when I am not at home. For those who don't know, Hu Tieu is another variation of Pho. It comes with noodles and meat. I prefer to keep the broth separated and eat the noodles dry. I sip the broth with each bite and it's quite a delicious way to eat noodles.

g6MhuxBw8WKJMAO3CpB1dA.text: I have been there 2 times in one week. That's how yummy this place is.  The reason I like this place so much is because it is much more tasty than other Vietnamese restaurants I've tried out. They have a large menu so you have much to choose from. I only had take out, so I'm not sure how the service is other than take out. Try this place out if you like Asian cuisine. Man, I'm hungry now just thinking about it.

NhkipROsAJf2DY8ux_J59A.text: Small and cozy place to eat with low light setting. I was happy with the food that we order. I got "com suong bi cha thit nuong" which is not bad. My friends say the pho is good too. Would come back.

tC3O1oA-tzf84CGtHveYHg.text: Why the heck did i try this place again? ... Horrible walked out service just awful didn't even order.

N12ltNWkBfmdS09iWVE-9Q.text: Ordered take out over the phone... The girl taking my order was a bit sassy! When I arrived at restaurant she was sitting at cashier station... She did NOT greet me when I walked in! She told me the total, I handed her my credit card... then she asked "if I happened to have cash"!  WTF!!??? If I had cash don't you think I would have given cash??!! Duh!! Well at least she thanked me as I was leaving.   Food was good so that's why I gave 3 stars! Too bad cashier was sassy & not friendly!!

1bk57fLo-FlscUfsl7OQJQ.text: Its as good as it gets for Henderson.....lots of way better Pho places in Cali but I live in Vegas and this is as good as it gets for me until the next time my mama comes out and makes her Pho it at my house!  I always have the same thing...Hu tieu wonton, Pho Tai, Pho Ap Chao.. always good..nice clear broth, good flavor and they don't skimp on stuff like other places. I did try the Bun Cha Hanoi once, big mistake...my mom makes the BEST bun cha hanoi so I thought I'd try theirs...well the skewered pork was tasty but the patties were awful!  There was no flavor to it what so ever!! Too bad, I was really hoping to enjoy that since my mom only comes out every few months to make her version of what my friends call "Lei Mama Patties". Oh well, c'est la vie... I still love this place either way and am here at least once a month!

EDeLcbajeLMeDDALxMQwhQ.text: random viet restaurant in a strip mall - didnt even know it existed as you really can't see it from the street. they have a wide range of vietnamese food, including diff sizes for pho. one of the few places that have the tomato based crab and pork meat noodles - which came with 3 huuge blocks of blood cubes. not a fan of those but luckily was able to pick those out.   overall, decent place for cravings.

685QOiCYfkclXZakGmDfQA.text: We've been looking for a yummy Pho for a while and Yelp helped us find Pho Saigon 8!!    I ordered a Tofu vegetable Pho while the boyfriend ordered Chicken Pho and Spring Rolls. (bill came out to $20 and change)  DE-LICIOUS!  Eric said his chicken was moist (not the usual overcooked and dry) broth was a perfect, steaming hot- but NOT burn your mouth hot.    ...Talk about FAST food, the spring rolls came out minutes after we ordered it and our Pho came out as Eric was finishing up his appetizer (and he eats fast!)  it's a smaller restaurant and was packed at 5pm (it's a good sign that the food was going to be good!).  The decor is nice, table tops are some kind of stone/granite (no booths) and it was clean.  I'm agreeing with another reviewer, it's a tight fit and the tables are a little close together and I don't recall any type of music playing.  The service was friendly, nice and quick- although there was not much rapport between us.  They were great about busing the tables and keeping it clutter-free (my pet peeve).  Must agree with another reviewer, the parking lot is a little small...   Despite the semi-negative description of the restaurant itself, don't let that stop you from eating the YUMMY food!!  I overheard customer at another table complementing the server for the GREAT food he just had.  He introduced himself to the server and told him he would be a frequent customer.. :o) = so I know I wasn't the only one Raving about how good the food was!!!  5 stars for delicious food at a great price, nice sized servings (was a bonus) and quick and friendly service.  This will be a restaurant that we re-visit a few times a month- I know it!

LVZgbbzB8jBY8Cs4Qh6yiw.text: This Pho restaurant is ok if you are not able to go to CHina Town.  They are often crowded and the tables are too close together.  The Pho is pretty good and so is the BBQ chicken rice plate.  That sauce to dip the chicken in GOOD!  We go there when we dont want to drive to far.

nkTS6lOtt_fDvR0WhsrMHA.text: Unfortunately, I'm not a fan of pho, so I hope this review proves to be useful for those who are like me, and would rather eat something else at Vietnamese restaurants.  This place is closer to me than Chinatown, so that's a plus for me.  My favorite dish is #71, the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio, a.k.a. grilled sliced pork and fried egg rolls over vermicelli noodles and vegetables.  The pork has great flavor, almost a sweet taste to it, and I love the combination of pieces of pork and eggroll, noodle, and peanuts in one chopstick-ful (as opposed to spoonful).  Delicious and cheap!    It can get pretty busy during both lunch and dinner, so the service leaves much to be desired during those times.  Also, the parking lot is shared with various other popular establishments, so it can be hard to find a close parking spot during peak times.   My experience with takeout orders has been positive as well.  The orders are packed well and the time estimates are pretty accurate.

C9KegftfxgmOKWNsWw3eMQ.text: I am constantly trying to find something that is closer to Henderson thank Pho Kim Long to satisfy my craving for Pho. This place did it for me. Thank god. Pho was great! Fresh, satisfying, and service was good. Even when we order to go, everything is packaged properly and ready fast. Happy Customer and will be back often!

UoBHUiIOMQaMn2HHZ3gVDA.text: I went here a couple days ago and I loved this place. I ordered the well done beef with beef meatballs and it was delicious! You can tell this is your better than your average pho restaurant because the locals seem to love it and it was packed when I went in the early evening. Don't know why it has a 3 star rating...should either be 4 or 5 stars.  Also, you know it's a good pho restaurant because it has pho in its name and a random number.

i0vLCNKATujzPG59axXrOQ.text: so I got this place mixed up with Pho Little Saigon. I did originally rant a rave about how great this place was but it was not the right place. my bad, sorry for the confusion. However, I did have the pleasure of stopping into this establishment after my work out at the las vegas athletic club (same parking lot). I ordered the seafood pho and this place does it a bit different with the items of meat in the pho. They give you tiny eggs so i'm wondering if its maybe quail eggs? I don't know if they do this in all their pho dishes or if it is just in the seafood one, but one of the eggs seems to be a bit off so I don't know if it was bad or what. The broth is strangely sour if you taste it on its own.  its a clear yellow color which is not beef broth like its supposed to be. After adding all veggies, noodles, and meat it does take some of the sourness away but the broth is not authentic. Its lacking in the proper pho spices/flavor. it really was just a sour/salty broth. definitely not a traditional authentic Pho broth at all. in my opinion you are much better off going to the Pho Little Saigon in the chuck e cheese/99 cent store/in and out parking lot on the other side of the 2-15 to get the real deal, you will be much happier. Its where I always go when I am to lazy to make my own traditional Vietnamese food at home. Don't even waste your time at Pho Mai lan, its a rip off very expensive for what you get and its not authentic either, their beef broth is literally beef broth with no Pho spice flavor. $10 for a bowl of Pho is just ridiculous especially if its not the real deal!!!

weTyqRrJaaZ8TgKmNU_5ag.text: Best pho on this side of town.  Not as good as the Spring Mountain location, but a really good substitute when you can't make it across town.  Egg rolls are the bomb, chicken bun is one of my faves, and the #31 is my go to dish!  Biggest drawback is the service is kind of slow.  Food comes out pretty quick but sometimes it can be a wait to get drinks and/or the check.

cAZTz2vb-bOon78ezVjshw.text: The rare eye of round beef pho is the best I've had anywhere. It really is what makes the not-so-friendly, barely-there service tolerable.

PtMp8tCkdeSNz4C2iHHbgQ.text: I go here all the time because:  1. It's always busy, that means food is good.  2. The bean sprouts and basil in the side are always fresh. The ingredients are fresh. I'm Thai, we Thais need something other than siracha. I only wish they had fresh ground chili.   4. Service is simple, they just take order and you get up and pay at counter, I like that. So the food is not expensive and one does not need to leave a huge tip.   I love this place. I seriously do. I just wish they had sandwiches too. Then my life would be complete.

Service was great Food wise wasn't bad, but definitely had better That's what took the star away for me Will go back for sure, to see if it'll be better to get that five star

I hope the next time I go back the service is better.

L11WeQI_UdgmL_US81fVgg.text: I was never a fan of Vietnamese food.  The first time I ever ate it was over ten years ago and thought to myself how I'd never eat it again.  I met my ex from Seattle and moved there for about almost 4 years and everywhere I went was a Pho restaurant.  After a while I came to fall in love with their food and only in Seattle.  I swore that there would never be another Vietnamese restaurant that can compare.  Today, mom decided she wanted to eat Vietnamese and thought what the heck.  I drove on Eastern, passed the I-215, and right by the Las Vegas Athletic Club was the restaurant.    When I walked in, mom had already been seated and luckily there was no line.  Last time we were here there was a twenty minute wait.  It's a somewhat small intimate restaurant with so many tables and chairs so close to one another.  So many people talking loudly, and plates clattering, sipping their soup loudly made me wonder if this is actually what it's like in a restaurant in Vietnam.  Looking forward to the day I find out through hands on experience.  No time was wasted and I gave my order of a #70.  I forgot the name but there was white noodles, some vegetables, herbs, barbecue shrimp, barbecue thinly sliced pork, and spring rolls.  The sauce on the side tasted like a sweet fish sauce with carrots and other ingredients to hide the gross smell of fish sauce.  I poured that in my bowl and mixed all the food around.  I haven't talked about fireworks in my mouth because it's been a while since I've felt that.  But, we're gonna talk about that in this review.  FIREWORKS!!!  When I put the food in my mouth, I literally felt like I was in the sky with fireworks around me.  I can still remember it like it was just a minute ago.  Normally, I don't like to eat past being full, but this dish was just too good to not finish.  The combination of the pork, noodles, vegetables, and sauce blended well together.  Food Network judges talks about texture a lot and this dish is not just mushy noodles and meat, but had the crunch of the vegetables and spring rolls.  The different texture was definitely there and worked very well with this dish.  Mom ordered something with seafood pho.  It was also very well made with crunchy garlic sprinkled on top.  Mom added vegetables and herbs to it which gave it a playful texture.  Her pho was also great.  All the food was awesome which is why I gave it a 4 stars.    It's just too bad that the servers were far too busy to give any smile to the customers.  They're all so serious and don't look very friendly.  I'm sure they're very nice outside of work but while serving my mother and I, we didn't get that welcome feeling like they wanted us there.  Sure, they gave us water, took our order, brought out our food and finally our check.  That's all routine.  There was no *umph* to their service.  It was just eh and blah.  3 stars to the servers and 4 stars to the cooks.  I'm sure they were in a good mood to be cooking AWWWWWESOOMMMMMME!

E-12CQz2gGeoftpNNr4FOw.text: Great Pho! Actually hot like it's supposed to be (not like other local places where the beef doesn't even cook).

fDxCzLHBSBg24jtbCbF-1Q.text: Really good Pho! The Spring  Rolls were really good as a starter and you get plenty of food for the price. Nothing fancy but just good Pho.

yWASJNS8akl6S5CBjF23Fw.text: I dont really know much about pho, but i thought whatever i ordered was really good. the service kinda sucked though.

A2ZyHK-cZVpbdvjdxSWK5A.text: Sorry. Just not my kind of Pho. The service was lousy, we waited almost 25 minutes for a bowl of soup. ?!?!

FYOmxvxyJkM0xJqrofQvpw.text: Looking at it as food only it was great. As a whole I felt like they didn't want my business. Maybe next time I will show up with an Asian friend. But yes the food was great.

VvRmzRcyTgFK2yMUY-hN0Q.text: Its alright. Quality of food is good. Taste is rather bland. Pho is a bit on the oily side.

wMwUqPTE-xNCFFV7lMwiYA.text: I think this Pho restaurant is just fine overall. Perhaps I never had an issue with the service here, or perhaps I know not to really expect much in terms of service in small culturally unique joints such as this one. I also think the language barrier plays a role in the type of service you receive.   The service was ok, no one was rude nor made us feel rushed while we, two of the most indecisive people in the world, reviewed the menu. The Pho was good enough to warrant a return visit when I am not feeling like driving too far from my house for a bowl of pho. They provide all of the necessary standards such as the condiments (I love me some siracha!) and a heaping plate full of additions such as fresh herbs, sprouts and lime to add as needed.  I think Pho Little Saigon across the street and this joint are almost identical in service and in quality. My review is more of a 3.5 star but I will round it up as I am feeling generous.

RQldK_0EFGbXA4pz1q3ySA.text: This place is always  busy but it beats driving all the way to Chinatown. Food is delicious  I like their  tendon and beef pho. I also order their small egg rolls with lettuce. Their combination  with noodles and shrimp is great. I just  wish they speak more  English.

aXsHjhmiokPAjLHWs2iufQ.text: Absolutely the worst customer service I have ever had. Actually I wouldn't even call it customer service. From the minute we walked in the atmosphere was unfriendly and uninviting. People that came after us were helped first. They never took our drink order and right before we ordered our food we almost walked out. We should have... Because it only got worse. Once we ordered our food and it arrived we were never asked if everything was ok or if we needed anything else. It looked like all of the employees had a frown on their faces the entire time we were there. Their lucky I paid and I definitely didn't leave a tip which I have never done in my life. The food was descent and with horrible customer service I would NEVER GO BACK. This place needs some customer service training, good luck.

eNXiqqJIbZvdPD4cd2REhQ.text: the pho and soup is delicious, the place is nice and average size, the pho I always order is perfect, the soup tastes good, the noodles are the best part and the employees are very nice and quiet

My kids love the noodles and we eat at this place atleast once a week. Fast service but the customer service could be more personable and friendly but other than that the food is awesome!!!

wFzDQ8iEsegVh9felJyi2w.text: I've only been here one time, but I didn't have a single issue that a lot of the other reviewers harped about. I was promptly seated and had my order taken. I went with a standard Pho dish, a combination beef bowl, and was thoroughly satisfied with it. The prices, contrary to what some people are saying, were also completely fair... Especially for Vegas. I plan on eating here again!

UHJAocrw4yjdPnREPxO2ww.text: Good pho. I save a trip going to Spring Mountain when I was living in Silverado Ranch area.

7c1ulYzs1oqiu_3GHaBAwQ.text: I didn't get any headache after having their #72.  Usually I'll get a headache after consuming MSG.  The meat was soft and tender.  Vegetables are fresh.  Staffs are friendly.  I can't say anything bad about this place.

mm7DrJFy3bURQ20xVZvM1A.text: Best Pho I've found in Vegas.  The place is fairly nice for a Henderson strip mall. Decor is appropriate and tasteful, you'd have friends and family here; unlike most Pho joints that feel like a Vietnamese Robertos. Not that there's anything wrong with Robertos, it's just not a place you'd take a hot date. Saigon 8 is. Actually,  a "best I can get right now" date or "I'm feeling fat/unemployed" kinda date, but regardless, you won't be ashamed of this place.  The Pho is excellent. Standard pho gringo rules apply with Pho, stick with the Pho tai until you know what you're dealing with. Tripe is not for the unfamiliar stomach.  One amazing thing they do here that's apparently illegal in Vietnam: the veggie pho actually features veggie broth, and IT'S MARKED ON THE CONTAINER.  Also a fun game we play every time I call: I say: "Hi can I have a Pho Tai and a Veggie Pho please? Extra meat and extra Jalapenos" They say: "(Vocal Noises sounding mildly like english that may or may not be confirming my order.)" "I didn't catch that, was that a Pho Tai and a Veggie Pho" "(Garbles that may be English with incomprehensible accent)... 10 minutes". "Okay thanks"  And my order has always been right over 10+ visits. Always extra Jalapenos, always extra meat, never any missing sides. This impresses me more than anything else.

aCqzYa-8WVTQ_3ybrEFW-g.text: These guys are great for quick service! if you feel like take out or dine in, they will definitely get your order out quick and efficiently! Their tai tea is on point and is always a smart pick if you've got a sweet tooth like myself! I always order from there when I'm in need of something to fill me up and fast!

KTENJ3CZOciy-qtOrDkoxg.text: Food is pretty good. Always consistent.very fast service but the servers are not too friendly.

nTocMBkEQrE21LebDqnykQ.text: The pho served here is quick and tasty. It satisfies the nightly pho cravings and is a good place for those who live in the Henderson area, as it nearby. But there are better pho places in Vegas, if you are willing to drive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large pho with rare beef and tripe

0MNBJdUkJqtFaTjVK0XAQA.text: I come in now and then if I happened to be in the area. It is really a shame when the server makes you feel like you are putting him out,  because I pointed to one of the many empty tables throughout the restaurant. Then, if that is not bad enough...when he brings me the menu, I quickly tell him that I know what I want and am ready to order. He looks at me with a blank look and leaves to go talk and reminisce with another table while I just sat there.  He looked confused when I got up after a few  minutes (never to return). I had decided there are too many Asian restaurants that would appreciate my simple order.  I drove to one of the nearby Asian restaurants a mile down the road that made me feel welcomed with delicious food.  When the owners of a business entrust customer service to a server that does not see the big picture by protecting the brand that provides a roof over his head. It's just a matter of time before it tilts to dead.

VdXNKYZcetXiFx6Ecgt_dQ.text: Excellent service, delicious and fast service. Love the Pho, hot tea and recommend visiting it at least once a week! (Lol) I recommend this place for dinner or lunch, intimate setting with a clean atmosphere. Here's a picture of my food... #29, Vegetable Pho with tofu

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7rUHsnUjkAHfRdAgPYExsQ.text: We were trying this place for the first time. Not only did we ever get asked what we wanted to drink but I found a caterpillar in the lettuce that came with the egg rolls. Luckily we had just started eating when I noticed it. We were so grossed out we couldn't eat anymore. We told the waiter and all he said was oh sorry about that and walked away. We ended up leaving the place. The manager told us I won't charge you for the egg rolls but we still had to pay for the pho which we hardly touched..not going back there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was in th lettuce that came with the egg rolls. I had just started eating when I noticed it. Not going back.

fezf_1L_uYdKWR13d1QgFQ.text: This has been my go to Vietnamese spot since I've lived here. Consistent and good Vietnamese food at a fair price. The service could always be better, but that usually goes for most Vietnamese food spots. I will say I do like that they bring out scissors to cut the kid's noodles, this helps.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai Bo Vien

Scv_KZXCeAIb1SVtiwLEAA.text: Pho Saigon 8 is a solid place to get pho and they have multiple locations s in the Henderson area.   Came with my family and we all ordered a large #18 pho which comes with rare eye steak, flank, brisket, tendon, and tripe. It was delicious and definitely a good portion of meat and noodles. A solid 4/5.  We also ordered a small bo of bun bo hue - a spicy beef noodle soup which came with a thicker noodle. Wasn't a huge fan of the broth, almost felt a bit watered down spice wise compared to what I've had at other places. For the small bowl for $9.45, I'll probably skip this for next time.   Other than that, service was good and they gave generous portion of bean sprouts, basil, jalapenos and limes for the pho.

BcPIOTMc1STFexI26hLT8Q.text: It's decent pho, regular pho place honestly. Nothing special about it. Overall a clean area, good wasn't bad. But I got the Thai tea with boba. The drink was good but the boba itself was not fully done. So it was hard and disgusting, not like chewy at all. I was extremely disappointed but I mean, it is what it is. I'm just letting others know, the boba isn't good. Overall service was decent. Got the food in good timing. Price was reasonable.

dxWI5BuK1q9m33CnizORbA.text: Interior is a little rough but the Pho and Egg rolls are fantastic. The service is always great. We normally do take out and they get the Pho packaged up very nice.   I don't do the numbered meals at this place. There's a reason that they have been in one place so long. A+

SgsbN0Aaw3-lLGi1m2ab-w.text: I used to frequent here for the chicken pho but tonight is my last night. Tonight I went in for dinner and noticed the person cleaning the tables and placing the dirty dishes in a bin.....on multiple occasions if a table left behind a partially used plate of raw veggies for pho (bean sprouts, basil, jalapenos, etc) the employees would carefully carry the used plate to the back kitchen instead of placing it into the trash or dirty dish bin.  I'm totally grossed out thinking I was consuming reused food!  Who knows if the customer touched or did not touch the raw veggies?!! You can never assume and should throw it away when cleaning a dirty table!!!!!!!  Sick this is totally unsanitary and disgusting. I worked in the restaurant business for a very long time and this is something that should NOT happen!!! I will NEVER come back here.

6XXox9ipIFraJFhJa2OozQ.text: As far as the food goes the pho is good. The broth is amazing. I've been all over this city and keep coming back here . I probably won't anymore because the customer service is lacking. Especially on the female side, the men are OK. The women seriously need to lose the attitudes. I don't know if it's a cultural thing but Wtf. Any who it's cheap. I guess I have to start searching for another spot. Food wise it's a four, but since service sucks it's an overall two . *** There is one nice waitress, she the youngest***  Synopsis : Customer service sucks/extremely rude/inattentive

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My usual large #11

REoOC7euubog2Ps7wv3uOQ.text: First time. Staff friendly. Menu extensive. Pho tasty. Noodles good. Cost benefit positive!

EzwjEyw-fCcPrgQJmRdyKw.text: First time having Pho and I am glad it was here. This place is close to my work and I had cold the last couple days so i thought soup was the ticket to feeling better. There was no wait, we were sat down quickly and the food came out fast. I had the #22 and was suggested ti add the fried rice with chicken and egg; DO IT!!! The fried rice was the best I ever had, EVER. The chicken was seasoned and grilled perfectly. The Pho was good and cleared my sinuses right up. Also enjoyed all the extra fixings you get to add in the Pho. I know where I will be headed when Im craving some Pho and fried rice.

Z2yBTmhRdZDgIz5GgCYNqQ.text: It is very good and always packed ! The broth is amazing ! Service is sometimes a little jumbled as there are multiple people trying to help you !!takes forever to get your check and end up just walking to the register !   They have a great selection of Pho ! Apps are good but been to other places and they are better !!

OCgeu9INszr74_zQZjaIQw.text: Gave up with this place. My favorite dish here was beef stew. It was fine in the past until last two times I ordered from them. They got the cheapest and toughest beef that I've ever had. 1st time I let it go and thought maybe there was something wrong with their inventory. But this is the 2nd time I got this kind of beef means they decided to lower their meat quality. Will never come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can you tell what kind of beef is this?

6QjUAmUOoxdutMRJ5xwimQ.text: We love this place for both dine in and to go it is a little small but both my kids love their broth. You can truly tell a great pho house by the smell as you walk in.

l99l1bWVLVExzbx1--AQVA.text: Great Pho for the area!! New to the Henderson area and we decided to try it based on the rating. Busy when we got here but not outrageously so. We were seated and our order came up pretty quickly. DELICIOUS!! Perfect for a chilly night!!! I DO recommend!!

L6rh-J4qYVzXmmlqj_bxtA.text: I got take out so this is just my observation from the waiting area. Plenty of local customers so this place is popular. It's located off the 215 at Eastern so you don't have to drive 30 minutes to the Chinatown area of Vegas for Pho. But they have yummy Bun Bo Hue, Banh Xeo, goi cuon rolls and decent. Vegetarian selections too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty crowded for a Tuesday night. They are loved by locals
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ejq44haMd1Bb3GP53GZoUQ.text: This place is my go to when I'm trying to get soup or spring rolls real quick. I live pretty close by so that could be a factor, but the food I order is always good! If I'm craving pho, I know I'll always leave having satisfied the craving.  Note I said the food that I order because I don't really order anything else. I always get pho, spring rolls, or some type of vermicelli bowl. My usual options never disappoint so I keep sticking to them. If I'm getting pho, I always get #16 which has rare round eye, flank, and brisket. It is so yummy and satisfying!  I love the deep fried spring rolls. They might be called egg rolls, but I'm not actually sure. It comes with lettuce, mint, and pickled carrots and radish. I usually wrap one with lettuce and make a little burrito with the extra stuff and pour some of the sauce on top. You have got to try it! Sometimes that's all I'll order and I won't even share it.  It's a good restaurant, it's clean, and it's pretty cheap, especially for knowing your food will turn out right. Not everyone on the waiting staff speaks English very well. That never bothers me but I'm mentioning it in case some people need to prepare themselves for that. Be patient and understanding, and you shall have a delicious meal!

F07iLSMATYSQ6xZeG8op7Q.text: The service sucks. They lost a customer over $8. Is that what the 8 stands for?  My food wasn't good, so I asked for a different item & the server told me I should've read the menu better & what happens if I don't like my next dish? Will I keep asking for more? I told him I come two to three times a week so I know what to expect & he said he sees a million faces a day how would he remember. I wasn't expecting him to remember I was just trying to make it clear I know what their food is supposed to taste like. On to the next pho restaurant down the street.

oANpDKIwziVaJFY2atD9IQ.text: The food is inexpensive and very tasty.  The service can be up or down depending on whatever I have had good service when it was busy and bad service when it was quiet(example we were escorted to a table when the restaurant was quiet, my wife asked to be seated at a different table, the host said it was dirty and left our water and menus at the table which we did not want to be seated and left.  We then waited for the table to be cleaned and then transferred our own water and menu.   I put up with the service because this is still my go to place for pho.   Except for one time when they placed our order to a different table by mistake our orders are usually served without a long wait.  If not for the spotty service I would give 4 stars.  Usually however they keep your water glass full(except once)

6alc8FpvVpDlytPYMEByuQ.text: This place was delicious! After flying all day we ordered take out and brought this back to our suite. We ordered a seafood and chicken pho both with yellow egg noodles.   Portions were filling, broth was tasty. Only complaint was the containers they put them in. We both ordered the large portions and struggled mixing the meat and veggies without spilling it on the table.

KOnJNt-9RFTfRsi_UqmNzQ.text: The entire menu is numbered. I ordered #43 which was a pork broth bowl with fresh streamed lump crab meat and shrimp which was DELISH. Everything comes out with fresh mint, basil, bean sprouts, limes carrots and jalapenos.  I went a step further and ordered shrimp spring rolls and lettuce wrapped egg rolls to complete my feast. The overall experience was absolutely amazing. I would highly recommend checking this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Number 43, shrimp, crab and pork broth bowl.

NGrpHL4PPMrsJgfO6Z8lzg.text: Pho' Saigon 8 is such a pleasantly wonderful surprise for me! My son and his beautiful girlfriend brought me here for lunch over Labor weekend. I have been back 3 more times this week with friends!!  The soups are a rice noodle base with almost unlimited combo's, seriously! (Maybe 50 different combo's!) portion are great, the small is not small and the large could possibly feed a family of 4! Jk  Absolutely love this place!! Get the today!! This is a great, fresh soup meal! You will be full on their soup, yes, on soup!

pfEX-7JncGhXqtVmRKUPpQ.text: It's not the best pho I've had but it's still good. I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come eat here though. If I'm around the neighborhood, then why not but it's not something I'm crazy about.

aq2ZWEoe_-nmNGmZ25PMEQ.text: There is an extensive selection of Vietnamese dishes here, including different types of pho for cheap prices.  I was able to stop in here for a fresh, tasty bowl of beef pho with tender rare steak and a Vietnamese ice coffee on my way to the airport.    As opposed to the bay area, this place is much nicer than the average pho joint where I'm from.  The furniture here is a rich chocolate brown color including the walls where matchstick bamboo roll up shades hang over the windows.  The table tops on dark wooden legs are a sturdy granite with green and brown shades.  Even the chairs are  unique with routered silhouettes of bowls of pho with chopsticks on the wooden seat back of each chair.  There is a nice selection of dark green foliage inside giving the restaurant somewhat of an exotic feel.  The service here is also attentive, friendly and good.  They will clear your table as dishes become empty unlike the average pho spot which waits until you're completely finished.

234nYWRMpz-70iWVVQpgWg.text: Really REALLY good. Ordered the Pork flavored pho and it was delish. The broth was one of the best broths i've had. Service was super quick and to top of the great meal the soundtrack they had playing was some super old school pop and it was awesome. Can't wait to go back!

ioAwqorcHkmeksLKeORfWQ.text: It's great pho, and the service is quick and smooth. I've come here a couple times and every time has been very pleasant. It's comfort comfort food for me, so it is nice to come someplace welcoming and with good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #31 chicken pho

Jg4TPtapRQJeOx6naCukVg.text: Food was good. Unfortunately the servers act like they don't want to be there. And when you ask for a to-go container, you get an eye roll. Not even a thank you or have a good day. Sad because I liked the food.

A4iJiNpdaa9cuz4Tp1G7Ow.text: It's a nice little spot that I've taken a few friends to.  Cant go wrong with a clean environment and fresh food ;)

CzWrZplRbTnDkxhhclo0tA.text: Sooooooo good. I love this place. The pho is seriously the best. Please give this place a try. The lemon grass beef is awesome (#56). Just eat it. Onto the pho...... if you've come here and reviewed it as "not tasty" or "tasteless" then come on back and throw some sriracha in your soup. It's not needed though. The soup is fantastic.  If you want some damn good Vietnamese food, this is the place.  One last thing.... ALWAYS tip your server. Please.  Understand that you're walking into a restaurant that serves food from a different culture.  Enjoy!!

g6kIGcJi0ZMVgpf5lXJJnA.text: Dependable and consistent. I love pho and eat it in every season so I'm glad I have a place that I can count on.

XyRueWR2dvoK0sY7ej7hKg.text: Before I was introduced to pho-milan.  I would always go here especially since it was right next to LVAC and I would usually come here for a quick bite to eat after the gym or craving for some vietnamese food.    The food was just okay nothing amazing.   Spring Rolls: It is usually a hit & miss thing. Sometimes its tasteful and sometimes is very bland.  When its bland I would have to use a lot of the dipping sauce to have some taste to the spring rolls.  Pho: I normally dont order pho, but when I finally did, I hated it.  I forgot what I ordered but it was not great at all.  It was cold and I asked them to reheat it, but one of the servers didnt understand what I was asking.  They had to ask another server to figure out what I wanted.  But after they reheated it, it wasnt something I would order again.   Pork&Rice: I usually order this and in order for me to enjoy it. I would always use the pho's broth that they bring on the side and I would add it to the meat and rice to have more flavor to it.    Service:  They normally dont smile when you enter their restaurant and only one or two of them is friendly.  I would have to flag them down to re-fill my glass of water and ask for the check.

9Ybqqxl-dgDQ4--uoi54PA.text: What's there to say they are great. Never had to wait that long from ordering to the end . love the pho best in town . will continue to enjoy there service and awesome food and dining. They are also very clean.

RJNh8XJK6OTxxGA9BgpQbw.text: I am local, been there multiple times and never disappointed. The portions are big with lots of meet, service is very good for this type of restaurant. Price is also reasonable. Parking is plentiful.

uJNmQrDH_6os-p4IqJNIbw.text: We came on a Sunday evening and ordered 1. #12 Pho tai chin, 8.05 Large  2. #60 Com ga roti, 8.05  for $20  - Conveniently located right off the 215.  - Legit Viet restaurant! Cramped seating. Waiter speaks Viet to take our order. Grandma serves us our meal. Pay at the cashier after you finish eating. The only thing missing is a sign that says cash only! haha! Love it!  - Pho tai chin: noodle soup with rare eye round steak and well done lean meat Steaming hot when served. Broth was good, but average. I liked how the well done meat didn't have a lot of fat on it. Need more bean sprouts and cilantro.  - Com ga roti: roasted Cornish hen, served with French rice or steamed rice, 8.05 Delicious French rice. They made it crispy and dry enough where you can still taste the tomato paste and not soggy. The chicken was a bit burnt and quite small. They did give plenty of vegetable sides and broth side soup was a good compliment. Seems like the side soup is what they would use for their wanton soup.  - Viets eat here so you know its good. - It takes hours to make the broth of pho bc you have to cook the bone. Just because its fast, doesn't mean its old. It's marinated.  - Prices are cheaper than others in Henderson. I think this place gets mixed reviews since it's Henderson and expect American style service.  - Similar to Spring Mountain

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aWodWCto3ER9u89fGAOpUg.text: This is my go-to pho restaurant here in Henderson (for the record, I have not yet tried Pho Mai Lan down the street). As a Vietnamese girl who grew up in Orange County (the largest congregation of Vietnamese people outside of Vietnam), I can only give it 3 stars.   The food is "good enough" to satisfy my cravings, but nowhere near the best or even mediocre Vietnamese food in SoCal. They have a really great variety so I can get pretty much anything I'm craving, and their Vietnamese iced coffee is really good (and properly served with a drip thing over a mug with condensed milk and a cup of ice).   Yeah, the staff isn't super friendly, but that's how Vietnamese restaurants are, in my experience. They hussle you in and out and don't really come back to check on you - pretty standard. However, the one thing that's incredibly annoying is that they insist you order by the menu item # and when the food comes out, they say the menu item #. I have terrible memory, so I can never remember what number I ordered (I remember the name in Vietnamese because it's usually a staple that I order frequently).    They are really good about splitting the bill by item / person if you come here in groups as my friends and I frequently do. You just pay at the front and tell them what number dish you had. No credit cards under $10.

atrx2Klks96NIOU08JUs6w.text: Passing by this place to give it another try.. Not holding my hope up..   First thing walking into the restaurant, what's up with flickering lights? Are we in October hollowing hunted house already? Don't like hunted restaurant!!  Services still poor, there are NO soup spoons on the table we were sitting at! I asked for it, of course, non came. I had to seek spoons from adjacent table!   Then as we wait for waiter to get our orders, he expressed they had RUN out of basil for pho noodle soup!!! It is unheard of! Sounds like breakfast restaurant telling me they run of eggs and bacons at 06:00 AM as I just sit down in their restaurant.  Then we were out of cold water, I asked for more water. It only took 10 minutes for the water made it to our table after 8 other tables got their fresh water refilled!?!? WTF!?!?  Hunted restaurant!? No soup spoons, no waters, no basil for pho noodle soup!! Sorry, Pho Sai Gon 8 at Henderson, you fail again as customer services!

VCMQCBOLTG_L_oSvP-yX8w.text: I come here during the summer when it's 118 just for their pho. Pho Saigon 8 has the best pho in Vegas.  I could sit and drink the broth all day long. The noodles are an added bonus. And a little siracha, a little sweet sauce, toss in some bean sprouts, basil and a few jalapenos and you're set.   Very friendly wait staff, usually pretty quick with seating, getting drinks and taking your order.   I don't know what I'm going to do when I move to LA!

eFQEDv28urbQ80fQSpRZrA.text: My friend Matt brought me here for my first experience with Vietnamese food and it was delicious.  The service was great.  I was apprehensive at first going somewhere that was out of my element, but a couple minutes later I was happy to be there.  Food tasted fresh, hot and so yummy.  I loved it so much I took my mom.  She polished off her bowl before I did! I can't wait to go back again.  Now who should I take, hmm?

z0AcJA5tINBU1AVHDYww6w.text: I've been eating at Vietnamese Pho restaurants my whole life. Coming from LA, I tend to be a Pho snob but this place is soooo good. I got the one with everything rare. The soup is clean but full of flavor and the large bowl is PACKED with ingredients. Exactly what I'm looking for before a long ride back to LA and decently priced!

GkNsHjUIln0dwcsn8QCYSQ.text: I love pho and all sorts of soups in general. I usually order the hot soy milk, #14 pho, spring rolls or regular fried egg rolls. It all taste yummy as just like the first original location on Spring mountain in China town. Unfortunately, I'm a shame to same I still constantly come here bcos it is the closest pho restaurant near me (I live in Henderson). They have the worst service. Every time I come here, they either give me water after my food, or they never refill my water. When my family and I order other drinks or smoothies, it takes so long to come out. Like, it comes out after we are done eating and we just take the drinks to go. Also, I always ask for extra lime and saute. 19 out of 20 times, they forget. Not to mention, these mistakes happen whether it is slow or busy.   If u want good service, don't come here.

S_kvOYBju8snzlrIXUpaFg.text: I ordered a chicken rice noodle dish and there was barely any chicken.  It was all Noodles and the chicken was dry with no flavor.  They used to be a lot better.  I still think I like the pho but that's about it.

yEshcHZxfANqmEewk8rhBw.text: This is now the best Pho restaurant in town. Excellent customer service and the pho are amazingly, addictive. Better than Pho Kim long!   If the drinks were free refills, then it would be 5 stars hands down!   Overall, excellent place! Booyah!

FLnDw1TEgrX79g-BlTs8cg.text: I guess I made a wrong choice today.   If you can't make the food right, then shouldnt you only focus on what you are good at? Dont make a menu with 100 of choices and none of them taste good. (We ordered 5 differents food on the menu and all of them have weird taste) The service are amazingly awful. No greeting, no smiling, no customer interaction, Nothing.  I paid not only for the food but also the service. If your foods aren't good enough. Make it up by the service.

7bxZXi7cSJ0WkP864I8faQ.text: We are here every week because we absolutely love this place. Affordable price, big serving, good tasting food.

KFhBwuTdsLpvq8dq6ruSUQ.text: Overall it's a decent pho restaurant in Henderson. The staff is quick and pretty accommodating to certain requests. I believe they do automatically add gratuity of parties 6 or more,  which is fine... In the past, I have ordered pho, hu tieu, banh canh, egg rolls, and bun bo hue...This is a variety that I normally don't order at other pho restaurants. Typically I just order pho with rare steak, tripe and tendon (which is pretty ok here)...so this just means Im giving this place a chance to outshine the typically mentality I have of pho restaurants. And gladly I did!! Yes, I would come back to try other dishes on their menu....

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue! Decent :)

Wjy9k6dRTNkIDcYFoU2zMw.text: My husband walked in and was seated immediately, which was pretty fast on a friday during lunch hour and it didn't take them long to take our order.   My husband usually gets the pho with rare streak only and I like to get the Hu Tieu - dry with the cellophane noodles. So far so good but once we got our food it was a different story.   Hubby's order was fine but mines came with soup. Not dry BUT with soup!   So I made a complaint to our waiter (the only older man with glasses) and he said that I DID NOT order dry noodles. And I told him I did, my husband even heard my order. The waiter also said he can not change my order because I "didn't order it right". And basically blaming me because I didn't order it right. Ok fine, whatever I'll just eat it so he'll be quiet. I' m not the type to start any confict. I took the first bite and wasn't happy it wasn't the dry version. It tastes totally different and I didn't bother eating it again.   Just when were about to leave to pay our bill, the waiter comes back and noticed i did not eat it and he offered to change my food. Seriously ? What happen to "I can't change your order?"   Anyways, I wanted to see the manager after this but they supposedly don't have a manager. So I just told the lady who managed our bill what happened and she apologized for his service. She knew who I was complaining about and I didn't even have to point out who it was. She also offered to take my order off the bill and all we had to pay was for my husband's pho. So thank you for that.   That is why today I gave it 3 stars if it wasn't for the lady upfront who helped us. It'll definitely be awhile before my husband and I come back here.

apo4EWDHDeSXyNq2BDvD6g.text: The food is good and they are very quick and friendly  Only drawback, I don't know how many English speaking customers they get  here, but there it's usually not a member of the waitstaff who speaks any form of English. You usually have to point at the menu and hope for the best..

oO449toSGQENhbblVAE6JQ.text: Their food is good and all especially their spring rolls but their service is horrid.  I may be the annoying customer that disliked where they seated me and asked to move but 1) it was right after they set waters down not like there was tons of food placed yet and 2) if their dining area wasn't so cramped and dark then the corner right next to the kitchen would have been okay.  And I may not have understood that Thai iced tea was not the same as their regular iced tea because the person who usually takes me there and orders for me was not there this time. And of course, I have to send the Thai iced tea back even though I had described to the male waiter that I wanted the "clear" iced tea.  But for the staff to so rudely express their exasperation with me was not just humiliating to me in front of the person I brought to THEIR restaurant but also very frustrating as a paying customer. The waiter who brought me the tea I ordered wrong literally argued with me that it was what I ordered and though I apologized and explained what I wanted, he stormed off to the front counter with it and threw his as about yelling the story to the other two waiters, one of whom always grunts and groans when you ask her for anything.  And yet I never did get the right tea until after my food came and I had to ask the youngest waiter there who is very nice and cordial.   I don't care how good their food is, I don't pay them to get treated like an unworthy peasant while families of six or seven get star treatment from these despicable two servers. Will not be returning simply because they are so unpleasant to even order from and the girl is just there to text on her cellphone in between acting bothered by customers. Pathetic.

TqbdApMLScMwzBbuTBSZiA.text: Food was pretty good. Portions were nice size as well. I only put 4 stars because I asked for no bean sprouts and they forgot I told them that. I just picked them out.  Other than that they were nice and good service.

8G108AgmfLvXtdAjJdD4dg.text: Sat for 10 mins. Finally flagged server down and he took our order. 5 mins later and I still dont have a beer. They were in the weeds busy but kept seating the door for some reason. Got up and left...

MIZnJGUZK0LbWqo8552PIw.text: 3 stars.  This is the location just next to the massive LVAC on 215 and Eastern. Its in that little center on the corner right next to Teriyaki Boy.  The place is pretty small and feels really cramped if there are more than a hndful of people inside.   As for the food itself, its alright. On my last trip here I had the chicken pho and it was good. Tasty broth and nice juicy chicken. I think there was too much cilantro in mine, but it certainly wasn't a deal breaker.  Service was okay.   I dont know, nothing was terrible, but at the same time nothing really stood out either. I think the Lemongrass Cafe nearby is probably a better choice for some good Pho.  So 3 stars it is.

3h1jC2Ms4OkZm4oeRQVqKg.text: Used to be my favorite pho in the area  But recently,  the chicken pho is more like been sprout pho with the essence of chicken  They reduced the amount of noodles and meet SUBSTANTIALLY  Will have to try some other places  The spring rolls are good, though

sCZYQV3X4pcVcpyRcLwo8Q.text: Excellent Customer service worth 5 star. Pho was delicious.  The calamari was greatly seasoned and perfectly cooked. The place was clean ^-^ worth coming back! !

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XS8WtoO5gcz3hBTfvvBk7w.text: Food is always good here! I noticed they did a lot of changes. New menus and appetizer are much bigger now than before. Service is always ehh. It's ALWAYS a hit a miss. You would have to raise your hand or make eye contact with the servers/bussers to get what you need. I only come here because it's closer to me. But, if I were to choose where to eat I would say Pho Mailan is so much better! It's better making the trip to go further down on eastern for amazing food and service!

yE4EYskQGq-FFblXT0N8Nw.text: Okay, this place is a little hated on, but I think it's a pretty good option if you are on this side of town.  The Bun Bo Hue is not the best I've had, but definitely is one that has the most meat/pork cake/pork hock, etc inside.  It could be a little spicier, but I don't think the broth is half bad.  The grilled chicken/egg roll vermicelli bowl is pretty tasty as well, the chicken is very tender and flavorful.  There are negatives to this place, it's kind of dirty and the service is pretty bad.  Also, I've only been there a few times but definitely some inconsistencies in the dish.  One time the vermicelli bowl came without any greens....and one time I just got the regular bean sprouts when usually it's a different dish for the bun bo hue.  So not the best, but not bad for being in this area.

y9mSPFrLrFZzC7mVoGkuBQ.text: I don't know why this place only has 3 stars!?  The broth of the pho was de-lish!! The restaurant was very clean.  The service was fast and friendly.  I will definitely be back pho more!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xmSfJ9LU1RLx9GMz7uJUbQ.text: If you love Pho, then this is  the place to get it. I have been to multiple Vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas and Henderson and this is by far the best location for Pho.  I order the vegetable tofu pho and vegetable spring rolls (my most favorite Vietnamese side item) . The vegetables are always fresh.   The down side is the customer service. None of the staff smile or seem happy for business, but the GOOD Pho out weighs the slight negative. I always come here when I'm in Henderson. I would eat here everyday if i could.

PomCjnsC-eAroG-AY1yd1g.text: This is a great little place after the gym or for lunch. It is healthy and good for your diet, but also quick and good for your budget. Plus, pho makes you feel good in general. If you have a short lunch break, this place is great. I think this is the best pho place in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xkuFEq1FNkGPVo4bwtFkjg.text: Best chain pho restaurant in Vegas. Taste is closest to Home. This Eastern location is smaller and has a limited menu compared to the Spring Mountain location. -1 star because they don't have fresh squeezed orange juice or soy milk, 2 items I always look forward to at Spring Mtn location.

80SFfzaQRI50KCYJGIJJXQ.text: "I`m Pho-king hungry!" I make this joke anytime I know Pho is on the schedule for the day. Then I laugh. Then it's awkward.   Anyway, I came here with my friend yesterday for some Pho. This is her normal spot and my first time here. I set one foot in the door the the lady had two menus in her hand already and asked "Two?". Yes, but when did you even see us?! Whatever. We were seated IMMEDIATELY is what I`m getting at here and that was just fine with me. We were brought water twice(as in TWO glasses of water EACH), which was a little odd, but I figured they just didn`t want to fuss with refilling our water? Who knows. I didn`t care much about that oddity. Within about 3 minutes they came to take our order and luckily, I always know what I want. Gimmie the Pho, number 11, the one with the rare cow that cooks in the broth. You know.  Also, a Sapporo, please and thanks.   They brought my cold beer out pretty quickly but the glass wasn't cold(I know, I know. I like fancy touches, but still.) Sapporo as expected. Pho came out pretty soon after that with all the sides. I got a small and it was still pretty large. I love Pho and the bang for your buck that you get. Big bowl of broth, noodles(LOTS of noodles at this particular place), and some meat. I will say that there wasn't enough meat to satisfy my little carnivore heart, but it is what it is. The broth was AMAZING, which more than made up for the lack of meat. Add some lime to that bowl of broth = totally drinkable. So good! Some of the best Pho broth I have ever had. Noodles were..noodles. Overall, I would come back here. I found the service to be okay. They didn`t offer me another beer which was a little sad, but also helped me minimize my day drinking.

DqYafzw4L8gIeLsIDdi8Cw.text: Hella busy every time I come in, is it me or is it hot in here? Lmao the food isn't bad, but I feel like it could be better it's kind of plain to me. The customer service is why I won't be coming back. The employees do their job and nothing more. They ignore me when I say thank you when they refill my water or something. No personal interaction. Almost like a rush in a fast food joint. Seems clean though. Pretty cheap too.

NRxJapSKFpvQh1GZ_PSu3A.text: This place is great for a quick lunch or dinner. The food here is always delicious and always hits the spot.  What doesn't is their service. Usually the waitresses are rushing you, rolling their eyes, and just have an attitude. It's like they don't want to be there. Sometimes I question if it's the language barrier or not, but I don't think that's the case here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ERKhCEJsHYGt85zlrq0_0g.text: The first time I came in we were seated immediately and got our waters within minutes of sitting. However, it did take a long time for someone to come and take our orders. There were two other parties that were sat after us and their order was taken and delivered before us. That part annoyed me because whenever we would call someone they would say "I'll be right with you to take your order" but we proceed to watch them taking orders from parties who came after us.    Anyways, the food is really good! I ordered the #70 Vermicelli bowl with pork, shrimp, and spring rolls. Their sauce for the vermicelli was delicious! I have never tasted a good vermicelli before from other restaurants so for that it'll be my go-to place. Their green onion portioning are really small so it isn't as big/ regular sized as it is at other places. They took a while to refill my water during my last couple of visits so be aware that you will have to flag down your severer a couple of times. You would have to ask for the chili garlic sauce because they don't put it out on the table with the siriacha and hoisin. My fiance's plate and mine came out to $23 with tax, not including tip. I like their vermicelli Bowl but their service are slow when they're busy.

qUasSU1XDmdJ-BUETshFaQ.text: We were here yesterday for lunch and had some great Pho! We thought the interior was nice looking and were struck by how great the restaurant smelled! Service was friendly and we were never rushed. Excellent Pho and we will be coming back.

nBfybx94SltiH68LdCkCKw.text: This place is great if you're looking for a quick lunch or dinner. Their ph is pretty good and their servings are pretty large as well. I always order the egg rolls as well whenever I come here because they are very delicious, and never overly fried. Most of the time I've gone here, customer service has always been average and tonight was just horrible. The staff was just not attentive and were were given attitude the whole time. I definitely won't be coming back here anytime soon.

F1ySAhxUUUxmUpTsd_f71A.text: Very good pho. Reasonable and fast. I comes to this location often but my last experienced was disappointing as they died not haver limes and there Broth did not seem as flavoursome as usual. I'm hoping this was a once off and will try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Number 12 small bowl - rare round eye of need and lean beef.

d-EZEsJmzMceF3bZhCuqxg.text: Pretty good spot to get your pho fix.  Environment: similar to most Vietnamese restaurant, most people come here for a quick lunch or dinner.   Service: most of the workers are Vietnamese. I wouldn't say they are super friendly, but they get the job done. We sat down quickly, they got our orders fast and brought our food out quickly. You then pay at the front cashier before you leave.  Food: the food here is pretty good. I got the spring rolls which taste good especially with their peanut sauce. I get the pho special with the tendons tripe and flank beef. Because I was really craving pho, i really enjoyed it. The broth was delicious and the meat was good as well. They also give you the standard sprouts, mint leaves, lime, and jalapenos.   Overall, good spot to get your pho fix. It is in a convenient location, and you can eat quickly and get back to your business after.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho special
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggies
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

3-Yp6sQJTsOf31UCmJmzgg.text: Comfortable spot for some quick pho.  Environment: The inside of the restaurant isn't anything special, but it is cozy. Seating is done quickly, which is most important when grabbing a quick lunch. The only thing I would say is that when we went there, there had been no music or anything playing which did make the environment a little change. It wasn't awkwardly quiet because the sound of all the customers talking to one another at their respective tables filled the air, however some type of music playing could have been welcomed.  Food: To start we got spring rolls, which were nice and fresh just how I like them. Dipping sauce was good as well. As for the pho, they had a nice sized menu with numerous options. I like the ones with a couple different varieties of meat in it so I could get one which combined flank, rare beef, and tendon. The bowl was huge and the flavor was good. Probably was not the best pho I have ever had but it can compare to other pho spots in Vegas.  Service: Service was quick and efficient which is what I would expect. Never felt like I was waiting for anything or that it was hard to get anyone's attention so I would say that I was satisfied.  Overall I would come here again if I were in the mood for noodles and in the area (especially since Monta closed, and Henderson has a lack of noodle spots in general), however I doubt I wouldn't put it up there with my real favorite pho restaurants which I would be willing to drive farther for.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

3y6q8e6oeI7K827-Wud20g.text: I've been here several times now and I think it's a pretty decent place overall.   I really like their egg rolls and spring rolls. Both are yummy and the portions are decent for the price. The sauce that comes with both is really good.   I usually get the pho with chicken and that is my favorite option here. Today I had the pho with beef and I didn't like the beef as much as the chicken. The amount of meat in all of the pho options is generous. My husband was on the fence about giving pho a try, but changed his mind when he saw how much meat comes in the bowl. The small bowl is a lot of food and I can't imagine who would be able to eat the large. I like that they bring out items to help customize your dish like bean sprouts, basil, lime, chili paste, and jalapenos. I love adding jalapenos and chili paste for a spicy dish.  The restaurant seems clean. The service isn't anything notable, but it isn't bad either. The food comes out quickly and drinks get refilled before you need to ask. I like the check out process as well. When you are finished you just go to the counter, give them your table number (a sticker on the turntable at each table), and they give you your total.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #24- Beef Pho
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Rolls

jvaq92mhKyZkl3dMBs2MTw.text: Service was nice. I had bun bo hue which was not authentic. It tasted like they used pho broth for it. My spouse had grill chicken with rice, but it tasted just ok.  My drink was bad - (rau ma)- Too sweet. The kids had boba and said it was good.  I wouldn't personally recommend it other than for the nice service and pretty clean place.

F3r91B_u2fQRvMNbEm4Q2Q.text: I've been to other Pho Saigon 8 locations, and have always had great experiences. My first time to this one off of eastern, and will certainly be my absolute last time. I ordered a beef Pho without noodles and extra vegetables for take out. My mistake for not checking the order until I got home, since they repeated the order correctly when giving me the take out. I got home to find no vegetables at all included in my order. I thought simple fix, just call them and they will simply make it right, even if it's on a future visit. The manager I spoke with was an extremely incompetent uncooperative individual. He argued with me over the phone, telling me I ordered wrong. When I responded this is the same way I always ordered at the 215 and rainbow location, and they always got it right. His rebuttal was the Rainbow and 215 location is owned by a different owner, and there is nothing he can do for me. Being a business owner myself, it was apparent this establishment has someone that has no customer service skills in a high position. So at that point I just ended the call. He didn't have a care in the world, as if to say "It's not my business" As a business owner these are the type of people you do not want in a management position, because it is a very bad reflection on the business. So customers beware check your orders before leaving when you order take out.

lTxBk-TaeOpQGISxy-HgbA.text: Food is average for the quality of Pho but the service on the other hand could be worked on.

3XArgMz7mFmXqzZOMPYETg.text: My boyfriend and I mistakenly ordered Pho from this location through a food delivery service and we noticed the difference in quality. We did not enjoy our dinner and the whole time he commented on how the broth didn't taste good and I had to agree. I tried to find positives but there went any.   I'll stick to my local Pho restaurant that we frequent because we didn't like the food from this place.

Irritating and poor service today

The rest of the staff reflects his attitude.

vv_5aZGKnUIjenRhzhTJuw.text: The food is always great and comes out quickly.   Crispy eggrolls and pork vermicelli bowl are some faves.   Service is polite and never pushy.   Great place for a delicious lunch!

3_cvW21kzxKtgAGbMvGdUA.text: The wife and I have been coming here for over a year. When we first went the service was very good, friendly, and it felt like our business was appreciated. I don't know what happened but....  Out of the last three times we came the waiter (the same one each time) didn't take our drink orders, was very impatient while we were ordering, and my wife had to chase down a different waiter for water. FYI, all three times the waiter was that fat one that another reviewer found very rude/short. Speaking about the wait staff, did someone scare off all the female employees?  The strangest part is that food is exactly the same: fantastic. I wish Yelp would let us differentiate between the food, place, and staff as the food would easily get 5 stars while the staff (well, that staff that's left) would get 1.  It's very rare that I'd let the wait staff get to me as usually a return visit gets me a different waiter, but this place is so small that's not an option. Right now I'll just resign myself to finding a different Pho place.

iWAxQ_STSAKXuLQT23zyWg.text: The food is incredible. Best Vietnamese restaurant I have been to outside of San Francisco. Everything is fresh and the portions are generous. My favorite is the #12 and the vegetarian spring rolls.   The service is fantastic. The manager came over and helped us decide what to order.   Go here!!!!

-d0DvwApCWGwL1ONlzJ6xQ.text: Another favorite Pho place. The food is delicious like all vietnamese places i normally order the fresh egg rolls , fried egg rolls and the pork and their latte.. love the food here its pretty good prcies is pretty cheap as well the only downside to the place is the staff is not as friendly as the other vietnamese places.. I would still recommend this place if you are near this place just dont expect good service..

dW1lyTitId0TJ2CdjObv7w.text: Quick service, large portion sizes, relatively clean, good desserts, decent prices.  The flavor of pho was good but a little on the blander side, but I actually prefer it that way because I don't feel like I ate a boullion cube with the pho soup.  I was really impressed by the clean bean sprouts. My family and I eat a lot of pho at a lot of Vietnamese restaurants and this is only the second time ever that the bean sprouts came with the root ends plucked off.

18pZhxOAKrTlmGijA5JQbQ.text: Four stars because of the service....its a good thing i don't care about that..but only because it's expected from an Asian establishment...Other than that it's good Pho.  I alternate between three different soups depending on my mood..always good..Ive never not enjoyed my meal. The broth is good..not the best Ive had, but its good for when my personal favorite Lemongrass across the street is closed for remodeling. Booo. You won't be disappointed here. Its a good choice.

Ud8ABAaRYZXnuQzbfC72Ug.text: One of the worst 10 Vietnam Restaurant I have been to so far. The service here is terrible.  NOT COMING BACK. Gave this place 2 chances.

PTC_6U7tL-0pXkdVoJO_Pg.text: As a regular pho eater, I can say that pho is good here. (I am half Vietnamese and my mom is terrible at making pho so I often go out to eat it.)  The noodles are a hit or miss and since I'm a big noodle eater, this matters to me. Sometimes they are soggy but sometimes they are perfect. Though the broth is consistent and is one of the best in Vegas, making this place one of the few solid pho places around Vegas.   It is still not up to par with LA pho places, but as I have said in other reviews I have yet to eat at a pho place in Vegas that measures up.  The only thing that is below average, even for an asian restaurant (which says a lot), is the service.   I am used the okay service of asian restaurants where the waitresses are often overwhelmed with too many customers and often forget things and don't have enough time to give you a lot of time, so that doesn't bother me. What does bother me is when a worker is walking around like he has nothing and they purposely ignores you. I ordered a pho from one guy working there and never ended up getting my order. He even avoided me and purposely ignored me when I tried to catch his attention . Finally another server saw me and promptly got my order, at least she was very nice. I wish I could say that this only happened to me once (and I would be willing to overlook it since I come here often) but it was not the only time and he was not the only guy that did that.

yfkifQrm5X4uiDsyFPOocw.text: This is a cool place to enjoy great noodles.  1.  Spring Rolls - Had the Vietnamese Spring rolls here and it was very tasty! The dipping sauce and taste was very nice.  2.  Pho - we had the chicken Pho and also a meat pho with brisket, flank,tendons. I thought the tendon was undercooked, yet it wasn't and it was delicious.  3.  Broth - I liked it very much. It was clear, and had a nice taste of beef with green onion. Very subtle to me.  After I got the tasted down, I did throw some chili sauce into it, so, that altered it afterwards.  4.  Ambiance and others - Very small and nice, always crowded, and it a place where parking can be a challenge due to the large LVAC in the same log.  5.  Service -The staff are all young and very service oriented. You pay at the cashier and I have no idea how they remember what everyone ordered to give you the bill, yet they do!  I do love to have soda and they serve soda here in a can which is not as tasty to me as fountain and this means you will have to pay for refills......  Check this place out!

X4ZHBPY-gZzfbwKTCI20Qw.text: AWESOME pho.  The hubby had the dry rice noodle dish and his was excellent as well.  The spring rolls were good but I could tell they didn't make it to order.  Anybody who likes spring rolls know that it has to be made WHEN the customer orders or it it's just not as good!

VCumf7AHWh8jX7SixeHkvA.text: Tried several pho places in Vegas so far and this by far has been the best that we've had near Vegas.  Pho #21 and #24. Even better than some we've had in SF.  Soup was very flavorful and the meat was especially so.  My wife also really  enjoyed the plum drink as well, very good and soothing for dry Vegas weather.

EDL4nh4zIKVPzt72LpSUJg.text: Great broth! Very authentic with a ton of flavor! Great Thai tea as well. Service is fast and attentive. Usually busy but haven't yet had a problem being seated right away!

RsOsptowisVJPFleciC6_g.text: I would never go to this place ever again. The waitress/host was so rude. She got an attitude when I asked nicely for a high hair then ignored our table for 15 mins and never bothered to even come take our orders. We got up and walked out. Worst service I've ever had.  I don't recommend this restaurant to anyone .

XbOwQvq-UuPGRH_eDtgYxg.text: 5 stars for the food. But -2 stars for service and -1 star for their weird prices.   Food is good. I mean, typical pho and viet food with nothing nasty in it. So 5 stars for that.   Service...haha get ready. Ordered drinks and food. Our food comes out first so I'm waiting for our drinks. 5 mins go by..nothing. So I asked the waiter (the really fat one) and he gives this irritates look on his face and says "IT'S COMING!" well alright jeez. People normally get their drinks before their foods, fatso. ESP with pho...all that MSG, you need a drink with it! The others weren't really any better. We went around 9pm and I guess they were closing soon. Felt like they were trying to rush everyone out. Well hello! You're in Vegas! You expect people to have early dinner times? Whatever. The only reason we tipped is because we had a kid with us and she made a mess with her rice -__-  Their prices are so weird! 6.05 7.05 8.05 dude seriously? You are so stingy you have to do .05. I guess that .05 really helps the owner out but seriously? I've never seen more ridiculous prices. This place is already way more expensive than many other pho places. And having that .05 on the menu just makes em look more stingy.

bTYKsNHiiTzTc1ZJepjk4Q.text: The pho here is very good, not 5-star excellent, but very good.   My usual go-to when out and about is Pho Kim Long but my office is located very close to Pho Saigon 8, so as a captive audience it certainly satisfies when craving pho for lunch.   The service definitely leaves a lot to be desired in that no dialog is created (at least the times I have been here) and "friendly" isn't an adjective I would use to describe the employees.  That said, I'm not here to make friends, I want to eat soupl. And Pho Saigon 8 provides piping hot, delicious pho in less than 2 mins of putting in your order.

N7gkRn8R750PGL9pFtGnsQ.text: This was my first time ordering take-out from a Pho restaurant, so it was a bit confusing. I would only recommend they explain, or have on their site, or even have a sign explaining why it is served the way it's served.  The #11 was very good.

HprmN6WR9o77zazUwahfzA.text: To all the people who say I should expect bad service because it is a Vietnamese restaurant, I'm sorry you feel that way. If I walk into a place to spend money, I shouldn't feel like a jerk for inconveniencing them. If you hate your job, quit. I work in a restaurant, too, and I know we all have bad days, but nobody should feel unwelcome when they want to spend their money and enjoy lunch. To put it shortly, the service was awful. We walked in and were sat, and before our menus were open the giant guy who sat us was already asking if we were ready. Not yet, guy. So he walks away, does a loop around the tiny restaurant, and 30 seconds later asks if we are ready. Repeat twice. Then, he got annoyed, sneezed into his hand, and never came back (thank goodness.)   When we did finally order, I got Veggie spring rolls and bun with egg rolls. Spring rolls were yummy, no complaint there. My noodles though... soggy lettuce and warm noodles, eek.  My boyfriend ordered a pork stew over egg noodles, but what he got was gigantic chunks of pork fat. That's just gross. I took a picture of the scooped out fat... probably about 8 oz of fat and 3 oz of actual pork meat. I think most would agree that less quantity and more quality is preferable to more waste and less quality. When my food lovin' non-picky eater of a boyfriend barely touches a meal, there's an issue. Even he was grossed out by the bad quality.  I'll just keep going to Pho Kim Long in China Town. It's a longer drive, but at least I didn't get treated like I kicked someone's pet as soon as I walked in, and the food is fresh and yummy.

MJ5yA0e56gtnvVyGcPKarw.text: This is the only place I go to eat pho in town, it is so authentic and delicious. Getting great food for such an affordable price in an authentic venue is probably what makes this my favorite pho restaurant.

bH5T1cCGVBWpKdWkMaEVMQ.text: A must for anyone looking for delicious Vietnamese Cuisine. Very affordable prices and they offer great variety in their menu. Great location, and service. My favorite: #21..Large! :-)

L1sa9g3iIxwpIE56TOvOtw.text: Very very good pho broth! I get the special with everything on it! Their fried rice is good as well however it's on the stickier side . I often order to go, they are very fast! So far best pho broth I've had here in Vegas!

ilbW-g2drCMulS1X3AYMyw.text: Best pho in town! However, the service wasn't all that great. I feel like I was being rushed and a burden on them.

XY-7o-quQXSIX2OfiIbcUQ.text: if i could give 0 stars i would ! caterpillars in my soup?? so gross ! even when we told them they said bugs are in the vegetables, no discount, still payed full price for soup that had bugs ?? never coming back
