-dlByLyY3hy6KF4U3YaFNA.text: Usually I LOVE this place. Me and my boyfriend go here all the time for the yummy pho but my most recent trip here was sO ANNOYING. First we called ahead to take our food to go and they told us it would be ready in 10 minutes. Okay so to kill time we went to yogurt land (which is next door) and made our way to the restaurant and our food still wasn't ready. We we're told to sit and wait at the tables by the bathroom, so we did. Ten minutes later some customers come in and THEY KICK US OUT of the booth! There were other tables to seat them why they gotta kick us out and our food still wasn't done. We wait another ten minutes and I decide to tell them wassup like why am I waiting 30 minutes for them to give me some broth and noodles in some styrofoam? We didn't order anything fancy just the regular noodles and broth smh.

aGhH9HU5og-Dk-lZapZlHQ.text: I always get the chicken friend rice and egg rolls amazing. Always great service fresh food

Ivcc62AWx3lt4tBjIaBWuA.text: Couldn't give it a 4.5 so I gave it a 4. Of the Vietnamese food on this side of town their Pho was the heartiest ... most meat and veggies. Although,  you do pay a little more for that benefit. Pho done right is hard to mess up. They do it right.  Good attentive service.  I may be a little "westernized"/ "Europeanized" but I was a little disappointed that they didn't offer banh mi sandwiches.  But you can get just french bread. I also enjoyed the pork roles.    Good little spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PHÓ

-Ld964FeLNPze3X9HHQD5g.text: My boyfriend and I were hesitant on going here at first since they have branches all around town. We like local owned restaurants instead. We were nearby and needed something quick so we gave it a try. My boyfriend loved the broth. He usually doesn't care much for pho. It does taste different from all of the other pho places we've tried in town. Definitely coming back here, hopefully when it's not too crowded. (It can get really crowded)

5c0p99XB-HQgDymSRqG6fw.text: Over all, the foods are good and in large portions. Prices are reasonable. The place is almost full most of the time, but we always get seated right away. Services are not exceptional, but just enough to get good experience.

80YuaiCgJd_2gofkyMz2JQ.text: Food is good but SERVICE SUCKS. They forget to put in our order. Waited a long time and charges us 18% gratuity. I don't mind paying it but damn why should I tip for SUCH A HORRIBLE SERVICE.

NNJG28VaSlMrJjL2wzknkg.text: Service:. Fast and efficient.    Food: decent.  Broth was good.  Way way too many noodles for my liking, but perhaps some like alot of noodles.  Next time, I'll request for not too much noodles, as it is suppose to be a soup, right? Iced coffee is strong and on point.  :)  I wish they had chili flakes.  I like spicy food but I'm not into the siracha or chili paste as it is just way too much sodium but dry chili powder would compliment pho perfectly.  Hard to find spots with it. Maybe I should travel with my own stash. :p  Will try again.

qumqXsaaJn-P48jvJjMG6Q.text: By far the best Pho in Vegas!   I usually get the chicken pho, but switched it up to tofu recently. Either one is just as good. Fresh chili paste on tap is always a winner for me and the fresh spring rolls are awesome as well.   Service isn't always the greatest, but I've seen improvement. A bit crowded, but not that big of a deal. There's something about being surrounded by others that just want to enjoy a warm bowl of soup, quite homey.   I'll continue to come here for my Pho fix. I'm not a fan of experimenting once I'm convinced I have found the best!!

IT5zQvpmaCQEABB5bVxZNg.text: Ate lunch here and the food was excellent.   The service was very lax and non professional. The waitresses were just sitting in the dining room chatting, the kitchen staff were outside smoking. The only person working was the waiter who was an older man.   The food was really good and arrived to the table fast. I would recommend coming here if you don't mind being niglected after you get your food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Noodle soup

Uy_iX0AwOOKHK3rcUQj6Jg.text: Definitely one of my favorite Vietnamese places in Vegas. My regular order is #73, Bun Bo Hue. It is a thicker version of rice noodle in spicy soup. It comes with pork blood, tendon, pig feet and tripes; which is more texture than just the sliced meat or meatballs alone. Nice service and menu selections, great for casual dining.

lb9at6x7mEGLDHPO3yIgow.text: I come from the Bay Area in Northern California, so I was surrounded by so many Vietnamese restaurants growing up and I absolutely love the Vietnamese cuisine. So, since I've moved to Vegas, I've been in the search for my regular Vietnamese spot for whenever I'm craving pho or a vermicelli dish.   Food: As I tried Pho Saigon, I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the chicken pho and spring rolls. I usually always order size small when I get pho, but Pho Saigon only does size large, which sucks because I ended up wasting half of my soup. Plus, I was really disappointed for spending so much when I didn't eat it all (my cravings were too strong, I needed to buy pho!). Also, the broth was lacking flavor, and trust me, I love my pho so this really was mediocre. Well, moving onto my spring rolls.. the meat was so dry.. thank god I was able to drench each bite into the peanut sauce and sriracha, cos I couldnt just eat it by itself.   Service: I called in for a pick up order and the lady was in such a rush! Once I said my order, she quickly said, "okay give me 10 minutes" and hung up. Lol, she didn't give me a price for my order or anything, which made me not even want to go and pick up my order because I actually wanted to make sure I was getting a small size. When I arrived I said I was there for pick up and the lady said the price and it was about $17 for pho and spring rolls, so I know forsure it wasnt a small. I asked how much the price was for a small and that was when she informed me that they do not have small sizes. If I had known that from when I made the order on the phone, I would have said nevermind and didn't order at all because I forsure wouldn't finish that and I didn't want to spend that much on something I wont finish. But because I am not rude, I paid and accepted it anyway.   Probably gonna try a different Pho joint because this just wasn't what I was expecting from reading all the good reviews.. very disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8Zaoc-jjOfBXkVrlhPHYRw.text: The vegetable noodle soup had NO flavor was really bland and the beef broth had a very funky smell. The pork egg rolls were average and the paper wrap rolls had brown lettuce and were very bland with no flavor as well. They also had lunch meat turkey in the wrap which I have never seen before. Was not very impressed , will not be re-ordering from this place.

AAof13TY4JJgzLB71yBPqQ.text: The pho here is amazing! Service isn't too great but in all honesty the food makes up for it.  This place has the best crispy spring rolls, they're fresh and absolutely delicious.  The food here is very authentic, which is another reason the service doesn't bother me that much.  No one is rude here or mean.  They're just constantly busy, which makes sense for a tiny place that's constantly busy. As long as you have time the food is worth it here and incredibly affordable.  Definitely a place to try if you're on this side of town. :)

RKBIjph9TZmX7jp1l9MS_A.text: Came here with a friend for the first time to try out pho. If you don't know what you're doing don't order the large pho bowl. It's hard to finish everything. But I loved trying something new.

c9os2Bz7elr8lH9B9QgbyQ.text: I came here for lunch with several co-workers. The weather is cold and what better time than that to get some pho. We came around noon since my coworker mentioned they get pretty busy.   The decor is nice and they keep the place pretty clean. I wasn't in a soup eating mood, so I decided on a vermicelli bowl. My other coworker ordered some eggrolls to share and they were pretty good. Nothing spectacular, but they had a nice crunch. My vermicelli bowl was a little lackluster. I usually enjoy all the nice crunchy vegetables that are included and this one just included a few leaves of lettuce and some sprouts. Definitely not what I had hope for. The pork and shrimp were ok, but definitely not one of best bowls I've encountered.   Since they are the closest pho place to work, I'll probably give them another shot, but I'll try their pho next time. The prices are a little on the high side, but I guess that's pretty typical for the Henderson area. For now, I can't give them much beyond three stars.

Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vermicelli bowl

pRWmPiMuM5LHeGtQfsIhhA.text: Been here a couple of times very good I like the broth here better than some other places its beefier tasting

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9zDWBbQuifJtaTTsLPhaqg.text: I love this place!  I always get the #12 large size and it's always fresh and delicious.  Really good broth, and the meat is sliced super thin and they give you a lot!  The noodles are on point too.  My order is always to my table in like 5 mins, and my water glass is never empty, just make it visible on your table cuz they can get really busy.  If you want a nice hot filling meal, come here.  I live close, so it's my go-to pho spot.

3fRpUvHyTGvpwy1rlT0ygg.text: Good place to go for pho if you're craving noodles and not in Chinatown. My friends and I went here on a Saturday night, and were pleased that it wasn't too busy. After perusing the menu, my friend and I decided to split a large #11 (Pho Tai- Noodle soup with rare round eye steak, $7.50) while my other friend ordered the #67 (Bun Ga Nuong- Grilled chicken over vermicelli and vegetables, $7.45). I asked for extra bean sprouts to which the waiter didn't seem to have a problem with. Our food came out quickly, which was a plus.   Pho Tai- Better here than other pho places in the neighborhood. The noodles were the perfect texture- not overcooked, but still soft with a chewy bite. The soup was a little more oily (I could see oil puddles floating on the top) than what I'm used to, but still good and hot nonetheless. And the accompanying plate of veggies & herbs (bean sprouts, basil & lemon (not technically a vegetable or herb...) was fresh. The portion size was good- plenty of noodles & meat- with the addition of bean sprouts, I was definitely full.   Bun Ga Nuong- I only tried the grilled chicken, which I thought was flavorful and very teriyaki-y, but some of the pieces that I ate had too much fat on them; however, I liked the sweetness and charred flavor of the chicken.   I didn't really feel like the service was bad. I mean it did take a while for them to bring the check, but my friends and I didn't really have a problem with that because we were too busy talking. I thought the servers were nice. I also like how this place is cleaner than other pho restaurants I've been to. So I think I'll come back when I'm craving pho not only because the food is good, but because it's located right next to my favorite frozen yogurt shop.

3DtpW9xL5N3ZNoLZtSftiw.text: My husband and I are always willing to try new places!   We were greeted by a guy who sat us right away. Our waitress came by and brought us waters to start. Being first timers, we asked our waitress her favorites on the menu. She was so helpful, nice and patient with us as we decided on our order. Our food came out quick, hot and tasty. Our drinks were refilled in a timely manner and our waitress checked on us a couple times to make sure we were satisfied and liked our food.  The least friendly person in the whole place was the cashier. He didn't say anything to us except to tell us our total. He didn't even offer me my receipt, I had to ask him for it.... probably not a big deal to most people, but I expected the great service until I walked out the door.   We'll definitely go back to try other things.

AJUBxKoobYbbBV_aF0ZqYw.text: I'm from southern californa, and I'm vietnamese so I think I've had my fair share of "authentic" vietnamese food, and I think Pho Saigon 8 does a pretty good job. And for a decent price too!   I've gotten the Pho Bo Vien (meat ball Pho) which was good. The broth was a good flavor. I always add tons of lemon and Hoisin Sauce anyway.   And I've had their Rice platter with grilled pork (Thit Nuong) and egg rolls. I thought the meat was awesome. It had a good flavor and the egg rolls were pretty good too. My one complaint is that the rice wasn't your typical "broken rice" where the rice pieces are smaller. They served whole rice grains, which is fine but I was really looking foward to the traditional Com Tam.  My fiance has gotten their Bun Thit Nuong (Dry noodle bowl with grilled pork) and he didn't have any complaints. The fish sauce (Nuoc Mam) was decent, nothing too spectacular.   And the service isn't too bad either. I've gone when they've been pretty busy and I thought the service was moderately attentive. Overall this is a great place to go when you're craving a nice steaming bowl of noodle soup or just some good ole vietnamese food and you're too lazy to drive down to Spring Mountain haha.

A1o0m7HW6ZFQ4L74RIGH3g.text: Had the chicken pho, fresh spring rolls and Thai tea. Broth was very good. Not too cinnamony like most places. Minus one star for not having any sandwhiches. I was really craving for binh ma... Also they didn't have the garlic chili sauce. Not sure if its usual to not have it but back home in Hawaii, we had it everywhere.

LgvIu7shmwty6hnWn5iwVw.text: There are a lot of pho restaurants in this town. This one is my favorite for 3 reasons.   Reason #1 - It's got the word "pho" in the name, so you know it's good.  Reason #2 - They are from "Saigon", where pho was invented, so you know they know what they are doing here.  Reason #3 - The number "8" is a very humbling number to give ones self. It's better then 5 and not as douchey as 10.  So you know they've got class.  Yup, the humblest, most authenticest, phoiest restaurant on Eastern. Much better than Pho Saigon 7 and less pretentious then Pho Saigon 9.    Till next Tuesday Pho Saigon 8, when my parents will pay for my dinner again!!

bFjszTC4vv4isXXXHTO-Lg.text: I have traveled to many different establishments in search of some pho that matches the taste and quality of my mother in laws. Pho Saigon 8 on eastern and 215 is the closest yet. I routinely get the number 11. It comes with a plate of different garnishes such as bean sprouts, mint leaves, and sliced jalapeno peppers.  I add plumb sauce and saracha for an extra added kick that broadens the journey through taste town.  It tastes like life. It's a spiritual journey for me every time I dive into a bowl of this magic bone broth, thin sliced raw meat, and noodles. It's always clean and I've never had to wait to be seated.  The place stays full with a steady stream of regulars and workout veterans from across the parking lot. The cafe ser da is another amazing coffee treat that will spark off your day proper.  I've had a few other items off the menu, all of which were rich with flavor and filling. The meals are reasonably-priced and the service has always been superior. If you are a fan of delicious food from Veit Nam, a stop by here won't dissapoint. Lastly, don't fear the fish sauce.

aLOBthWXkpljJkpxBLaNoQ.text: This is hands down my favorite pho spot in town and I recommend it to everyone and anyone. The broth is packed with flavor and clean not oily , all of the veggies are fresh and crisp. Everything is very clean and fast-paced.  I'm a very picky eater and have a hard time most places when it comes to getting my order right but never once have they messed up my order... I even order to go confidently knowing they won't screw things up. The service is very fast for such a busy place and they're polite to my standards they make sure your cup is filled and like most Vietnamese restaurants are trying to get you fed and taken care of not make small talk to butter you up for a big tip (which I think many people are not used to and see it as bad service instead of doing a good job and efficiency ) which I find genuine and worth a bigger tip. If you do ever order to go make sure to ask for any extra sauce you may want because you only get what you order.

aShNSSJ-EfHKAFIfAL9zKA.text: Only got 3 stars because even tho the Pho was awesome, I ordered and paid for Spring Rolls, but when I got home they weren't in the bag :( I wasn't driving all the way back during rush hour to get them. Plus my Pho would get cold.   Next time I'll check the bag before I leave.

04xzbQK_fjO3C7SeZu6GQQ.text: I spent my childhood in Vietnam and my young adulthood in Orange County where the best Vietnamese food is outside of Vietnam.  Having said that, this restaurant is a good substitute of Orange County Vietnamese food.    Most non-Vietnamese will come here for pho, and their beef pho is good.  But their chicken pho is better.  You can order it with white meat or dark meat or a combination of both.  I prefer the combination.  You can also get Mien Ga, which is a noodle soup with the chicken pho broth and bean thread noodle, very healthy and yummy (bean thread noodle is a good source of fiber).    Another good dish here is the Hu Tieu My Tho, which is a noodle soup with pork broth, clear & chewy rice noodle, topped with shrimp, calamari, ground pork, and quail eggs.  It is a very authentic dish from south Vietnam and Pho Saigon 8 has a very good version.    As with most Vietnamese restaurants, the service can be slow and sporadic but the decor is nicer than many other Vietnamese restaurants in town.  I really recommend this place if you are in the Southeast side of Vegas.

SN96kOe5S_wrpsqhyxkwYg.text: Completely tasteless broth... maybe it was water.  Go to Lemongrass down the street.  Very dissapointing.

t1loIISIyJocDQ85H-aCTw.text: I'm not a big fan of pho, but this place really impressed me. Usually, I order the #55, and my boyfriend gets one of the soups. We eat here often.

qt9EiCaOu0WsZyLneAwxaQ.text: I usually get pho here because it close to where I live and it's pretty decent. I get the chicken pho and my fiance usually gets their rare steak Pho--both are pretty good and I like their fresh spring rolls. The pho is good because the broth is flavorful enough and I feel there is a good balance of the meats and the vegetables. Can't say that I like their vermicelli dishes though, based off the shrimp vermicelli dish I got. The shrimp was poorly cooked (dry) and there wasn't enough vegetables in the mix to balance everything out.   I've been told by my Vietnamese friends that this place is some what "Americanized." I guess I can see that....Oh and did I mention, at one point I was mortified to order from here because of their grade 'C'  rating? Yeah...I hope I didn't catch some food borne illness during that period...

MSCxsgoUJvEeSZCj4abBpQ.text: I am a big Pho fan.  This place is kind of hidden in the back of a shopping complex, but it is worth finding.  The flavor is there and the serving size is pretty good.

S1EM7wj_9fK4H9JyAyXDHQ.text: The fact that the server wasn't friendly enough ticked me of. I rather eat at a Thai Restaurant anytime. I didn't try anything at all. My friend said it was good. He tried the soup or something.

661bgoLTuUuo9zKTY10W0A.text: Amazing, tasty bowls of goodness! The prices were excellent for the portion size. Great for any time of day, this soup will put you in a full, healthy mood. Superb balance of soup and meats. Service was quick, but communication was a stretch. I still would go there everyday if I could!

TK-IAu2ymt_S9tPftRcfyA.text: There are other pho places close by but I really like it here. The service is quick and inexpensive.I t's very convenient when you want something quick and not terribly unhealthy after going to the gym.

73jC0A3cuqSi2GkevLiXDg.text: Yum yum yum. This hits the spot when I need a pho fix. They make a great variety of things and they are all tasty

Pg9tMPCoyXROwnJRIZcmkw.text: this place is mediocre at best, nothing surpasses the Pho in "little Saigon."  I had the Tai, Nam, Gan small bowl (same thing I get everywhere) &&had only about 2 pieces of each type of meat in my bowl.   We also ordered BBQ Pork Chops to go to eat with vermicelli at home, but word to the wise, DO NOT order it separately, you might as well get it with rice there for the extra 2bucks, since it came out to about $5/piece.

Vsu-9ml6gNaCoYfFsIwSPg.text: Came for good food, found out there's bug in soup!!!! I'm mortified and server asked if I want another one? I said from the same kitchen? No! Got up to leave and cashier told me I owe $20, I said why am I paying for food I didn't eat? There's bug in my food!!!  Don't go! Health warning!!!!

PLJOcH6CIoZ9bBaeZ8H5eQ.text: Food is good...but the service is just not up to Par.  They need to be a little bit more organized.

8dvUpwXyNClyZ68Q-DJj8w.text: Delicious and so good.  Bomb food. A must go.  The people are super nice and very fast.

uJr5JfqNytYz4LdncyJ9sw.text: Seriously my favorite place to get pho. The food it always fresh and so delicious. Great customer service, I go there once a week. It's become part of my lifestyle.

CFlR3jFFKYQjcePJ2Y1Rqg.text: So far this is the best pho I have had in Henderson. Was seated fast and the service was really efficient, no room for idle chit chatting but I am okay with that. Pricing is pretty standard for the many pho places in town. Broth was very good and the meat was tender. No oxtail option which makes me sad, but maybe i just needed to look harder. I didnt really need the spring rolls, but it gave me something else to compare with others. Had a nice flavor as well. Decor is nothing spectacular, but the place was clean. Still have a couple others to hit before I can decide which is my favorite pho.

iym4VQgNI8-sQrraLwo7EQ.text: Love this place!!! The food is so good. Step out of the "regular" and order the pork chop. This place is fast, delicious, and they provide quality service.

Vdo988cOuNqv3sAlPDDDSw.text: They need to update the menu on Postmates, there are many dishes and deserts have been discontinued. So annoying to call back and forth to change my food.

JflWEPPK2oK77p44hOex9A.text: Ok place, alway packed.  Phi soup was not hot enough to cook the meat and bean sprout.   The flavor were pretty good but got pretty thirsty later.  MSG?

cvMGB-Ht9v3jlbutB1lJ2g.text: Recently moved to Vegas!  Excited to find a good Pho place right down the street.   Great food. All seems fresh. Service is really good. Always brings me extra limes and chili oil.   Tried the spring rolls, pho, crepe, and all were just wonderful!!

lccxJYWurjMp3iHFxcnu5g.text: My favorite place for Pho! I can always count on hot meals and quick wait times at this location. My family has been eating here since 2011 and all of them like the Egg Rolls and Spring Rolls. I love seafood, so my faves are #63 (Shrimp w/Vermicelli Rice Noodles and lots of veggies) and #43 (Pho w/Shrimp and Crab meat and choice of egg/rice noodles). The price and service is decent. Sometimes the servers seem short with their tone, so that might offend someone who wants to chat or make small talk. It doesn't bother me since I normally order take out these days - they do have high chairs if you have young children and opt to dine in the restaurant.

04yc1RiUSDmRF2tqLZ4o_w.text: The best Pho in Las Vegas! I've tried them all and I always come back. My fav!! Simply, fast and delicious.

xfGDw61wVZqtfMlPvpvoHQ.text: I always order the combination pho.  I think they brought everything out in less than 5 minutes.  Maybe I've eaten a lot of pho my whole life and I cannot tell "good" from "great" anymore, but I come here every time because of proximity to the starbux, gym, and my appartment.  They have a nice selection of rice dishes too.    Interestingly, they don't bring the check. You have to go to the cashier to pay, so remember your table.

6xELnhCI4VFaV-Of1i4dRw.text: Best Pho in town without a doubt. I frequent there on a monthly basis because it is just that good. My favorite dish is the Pho Tai Nam, Pho with rare eye round steak and flank steak. The broth is so flavorful on it's own, I don't really need to use the condiments to enhance it. Their Vietnamese Coffee (I think it's called Cafe Sua?) is the best Vietnamese Coffee I've ever had.   Also, their non pho dishes are just as delicious. Sometimes I order a no 65: Bun with grilled pork, which is kind of like a cold noodle salad. And their egg fried rice is one of the best fried rices I've tasted.  I highly recommend it to anyone who wants really good Pho in Vegas

wk_u_NvI-5Ml7rwLJT9pdw.text: I have been going to this place for years and I know this place is not the Ritz when it comes to service but the Pho is good. Sadly, this time I am fed up with the blatant disrespect and poor service my family and I endured.I get there I am seated and my waiter is rushing us to order. We just sat down. I told him we are not ready we just got here. He comes back constantly within a min urging us to order. He did not ask us what we wanted to drink. I felt judged and treated horribly. The flat affect and unprofessionalism of the employees here has finally ended my love of their food. I will no longer come back and as slow as it was I am not surprised.  If you want good food with good service this is not the place.

S6fRR4zu-Ncd1QUxDmEbfg.text: This is my usual go to pho place close to home. The restaurant is clean, they get you seated quickly and the portions are fair. Make sure you take note that the pho prices on their menu are for the "large" bowl but by default they give you the regular size if you don't ask.   They have the best taste and value fresh spring rolls (they have pork and shrimp inside) I've had so far in Vegas. Seems so simple but yet other places can't seem to pull it off.  This place is pretty much a get in, eat, get out and get on with your life type of business. The service interaction is fairly minimal (which I actually like in some situations) so don't expect any small talk. They bring you some water, take your order, bring your food and you pay yourself at the counter when you're ready. If you need something else just flag them down and they'll help you. It helps if you know your table number which is labeled but they generally know which table is yours.  Your best bet is to do your homework on what dishes you may want to try, then go in and order by number.  If you're into really thick and strong coffee, give the Vietnamese ice coffee a try. I'll try to post a video of it brewing - it takes quite some time to funnel its way down into the glass so you can dump it in your ice but it's worth the wait.  My biggest beef with Pho Saigon 8 is that their Spring Mountain location is subpar and inconsistent in food taste/quality.  I will however visit this location any day of the week.  PS- if you like pork chops marinated in fish sauce and grilled.. It's absolutely wonderful here. Another popular item is any of the bun - rice noodle (no soup) dishes. Be sure to try it with the sweet chili sauce!

6m6jn4XkSTCmFgxQgJq2Wg.text: Close to the house, I frequent this restaurant when in need for something not super heavy to eat.  Overall it is one of the better Vietnamese restaurants around my neighborhood.  It actually gets pretty busy at times since it's in the LVAC parking lot.  A fair amount of seating, but we usually get take out.  Check your order though because we have on multiple occasions received the wrong order, and let's just say they were annoyed with us and claimed we got it wrong.  We always get their fresh spring rolls, and they provide a generous amount of peanut hoison dipping sauce in the to go order.  The rolls are also fairly sizable.  Not the best I have ever had, but consistent and hit the spot.  I get the vermicelli noodles with the grilled pork.  However I always get it to eat the next day because they always cook their noodles to long, and they firm up over night.  The pork is flavorful and tender, but the naoc mam (fish sauce) is fairly basic. I wish they used more herbs, garlic, shallots etc to add some extra punch to their noodle bowls.  My boyfriend appreciates that they have the Vietnamese rice porridge (chao) on request, but I prefer his mothers.  This one doesn't have that much of a flavor to me, and I get bored eating it quickly.  He also prefers their pho here above a lot of places in the valley.  They give a large amount of basil and and limes on the side unlike some places.  He always gets the combo.  They have some good jelly desserts that are tasty, a bit sweet, but less sweet than a lot of other restaurants.  They are a good spot when you don't feel like driving further into China town. Although I don't feel I have been to a Vietnamese spot in Las Vegas that has totally blown my mind yet, despite the many selections that have been popping up.

yZOLKqPj7BBGYEkUeL5bEA.text: Disclaimer- The food is definitely four stars, but the service is one to two stars depending on the day. Therefore, I'm giving Pho Saigon 8 an overall rating of three stars.  My mom and I have been coming to Pho Saigon 8 since my family first moved to the valley, almost four years ago, and the customer service over the years has just gotten progressively worse. The staff was great when we first started coming here and then as of lately, the staff has just been rude and unpleasant to be served by. Although this restaurant is not close to home, we still drive the distance when we have that craving! We used to come at least once a week, but now every other month or so.  We usually come for lunch on the weekend, so it's always busy during that time. The wait time can be a hit or miss.  I am a creature of habit and order the same exact thing every time. I order the #11 (Pho Tai) which is the broth, noodles, and rare eye round. As far as the pho goes, the broth is always hot and never warm like other Vietnamese restaurants I have been to. It's rich in flavor and there is a good amount of rice noodles in the soup. I love the rare eye round because it's not fatty. A plate of garnishes are provided for the table to share. The traditional Thai basil, jalapenos, lime, and my favorite, crunchy bean sprouts. I love my pho with extra lime, and if more garnishes are needed, you can always ask for more! You might have to ask more than once though because they can be quite forgetful. Also, condiments are a must! A nice squeeze of Sriracha and Hoisin always go into my pho.  If I'm hungrier than usual, I'll order a plate of the crispy fried egg rolls to share. The crispy fried spring rolls are a favorite amongst my family! There are four per order and it comes with four leaves of fresh lettuce as well as the dipping sauce. I'm not too sure what the dipping sauce is made of, but it's delicious! The spring rolls are filled with pork and a variety of veggies.  Overall, the best place for pho in the Henderson area! The food is great and satisfies my craving every time. The service isn't the best, but it'll do.

buetj3Iy_9Gy0htcUNlvbQ.text: All i can say was DELICIOUS! i came in for lunch today with my parents 'cuz we were hungry for some viet food and it was perfect for a chilly noon time. WbG9M4oBWVnckyJViQE3fA.text: There are many-a pho restaurants that seem to be on every corner of Eastern and the 215.  My friend had heard that this was a decent spot for a bowl of pho and upon arrival I was happy to note that it was not too crowded.  Once we were seated, we ordered 2 small bowls... I can't recall the number, but it was with the rare flank steak.  The bowls came out quickly and I requested some nuoc mam sauce and lettuce to put in my soup.  Our server brought back the sauce, but not the lettuce.  I guess it's my fault for not calling him back to the table... The taste of the soup was good.  Not the best pho I have ever eaten, but decent.  The restaurant began to fill up for the lunch rush while we were eating, so I guess we got there just in time.  Our check was dropped off at the table without a word and since we had never been there we weren't really sure if we should go up to the register or wait.  We opted to walk up to the front, which seemed to be the right decision.  I then saw a sign that said Debit/Credit transactions must be over $10 and my soup was only around $7.  I expressed my concern and the lady and the register gruffly told me that I would have to add a tip... which of course I was intending on doing, but the tone and demeanor in which she said it was kind of off.  I'm not sure if I will return because I want to try out some other pho restaurants on that side of town.

32KvVdkcdP38X7_-1HKA8g.text: I have been here twice and had the same grumpy old Asian man server both times.  I knew I was in the right place when I was the only white guy in there. It is always busy so that says something.  The food is really delicious and such big portions. You are definitely full when you leave.  I decided to take the wife and kids to broaden their horizons. It was an experience watching them look at all the condiments like the basil, lime, jalapenos and sprouts and wondering how they were going to use them.  I had the chicken and seafood pho, it was just as delicious as the first time I had it, with perfectly cooked shrimp and quail eggs floating around for a great rich touch. The broth is so flavorful.  The kids all had the chicken pho. They weren't sure how to eat it. I told them slurping was OK, just in here though..lol  My wife unfortunately didn't eat anything because the old man either didn't understand her when she said vegetarian and asked if they had rice noodles. He kept showing her items on the menu with chicken and just didn't get it.  So that sucked  It was a great experience for the children and I stopped someplace after for the wife.  Service is basic is all I can say. He takes the order, and drops the check off when you are done.  Next time, I want to find a place that clearly says what vegetarian options they have so my wife can enjoy with us...

ESr2T_2oWWmmY9SFbMWH4Q.text: I really wish I could give them no stars.  People beware when eating here.  Always check your food for hair and always check your bill when you leave.  We ordered fried rice and found a hair in it.  My main disappointment with this place was how they overcharged me.  My total was $45 and some change.  I paid with a $100 bill and got back $44.  Tell me does that equal a Benjamin?  Yeah, tell me that y'all deserve an $11 tip is total BS.  Man I was ready to slap a bitch.    So, I go back to the register and tell the older gentleman, I guess the owner, that the young guy that rung me up gave me the wrong change and showed him the change I received.  The older man was apologetic and corrected the error and said that they didn't mean to do it cause it was busy. But, when I went to pay it had already died down.  The young guy that rung me up didn't even apologize that he did wrong and fkd up even as the owner tried getting his attention.    If y'all are wondering if I left them a tip, the answer is HELL to the NO, would any of you after that stunt?  I simply just smiled and walked out.    Since y'all hungry for tip here's one: teach your employees to calculate your customers' bills correctly.   Basic arithmetic isn't really that hard, you can learn from YouTube and I ain't got time for y'all's . To say the least I will no longer be requiring your services.  Bye Felicia.

GX9h7T5Qca91EywonTmNlA.text: A bowl of noodles as filling and satisfying as a Thanksgiving dinner!  After spending 12 years living in Southeast Asia there is one simple meal that I miss most, a simple bowl of noodles.  Pho Saigon 8 will be my local bowl for authentic Asian noodle soup. Their noodle soups are spot on.  I had the Pho Tai Chin, rare and well cooked beef noodle soup. There are two size options, small or large for .50 cents more. The large double the size of the small and is helmet sized steaming bowl of satisfying noodle goodness.  Before the soup arrives the server delivers the vegetable condiments that you can use to customize your bowl, don't be shy, add them all, the flavors and freshness they add lifts the noodles to a heavenly level. Also, don't forget to spice things up with a healthy squirt of Sriracha and a salty dose of hoisin sauce. There is also a wickedly delightful bowl of chili garlic sauce that adds a solid hit of heat, garlic and a touch of sour. The rare thin sliced beef sirloin rests on top of the perfectly cooked rice noodles. Once you stir the beef into the bowl, the rare beef becomes medium well in the steaming hot broth, tender, fresh - scrumptious. The depth of flavors is uber stimulating to the palate and the sheer volume of food is tummy satisfying. You may need a nap if you finish the whole bowl!  My wife enjoyed the Hu tieu hay Mi Dac Biet (pork soup with seafood with egg noodles). She agreed, a fantastic, tasty, satisfying bowl of noodles. The egg noodles are thin and curly. She commented that the squid was fresh and cooked perfectly.  For an authentic taste of Southeast Asia, Pho Saigon 8 can't be beat.  Their menu is extensive and includes many other non-noodle dishes that we will certainly be returning to try. We just couldn't handle anything else on top of our hot tub sized bowl of noodles!  Aloha!

AkRslRooVjlU2B6lqy6aSw.text: Pho Saigon 8: Eastern and 215 Location (Eastern and Pebble)  Let's start with the constructive criticism.  It's smaller places, parking is a little tight otherwise you are parking in the LVAC parking lot.  And most of the servers might have a little trouble speaking English but not all and the owner is usually on-site and very fluent.  Now for the more important stuff, good food, and great price.  I've noticed you seem to get a little more for your buck here than I've seen at other viet restaurants and the food always comes out quick.  Spring mountain location: Same as above for food, good food for the price, parking is worse though if you go when it's busy but seating is much better and it's larger to accomodate groups.   Extra info: I guess the things I'm not crazy about but they aren't unique to either location is if you want to substitute something it's a huge no no, at best you can just have things removed.  And I think the soup only comes in a mainstream size, maybe not quite large but you can't order a small but some dishes come with a small size of Pho minus the meat.

tpoiN4pf-kbAIQlBA19NSQ.text: I've been here many times, and each time I always think "Why do you keep coming back here??"  The service is *horrible* and the food is just okay.  They recently raised their prices, so I have less incentive than ever to come back.  The waiters always act like they are so annoyed to be serving you.  Last time I went, I ordered a pho with tripe, but there was no tripe in my bowl.  When I tried to tell my waiter, he just laughed.  I don't think he understood me, but instead of trying to, he just laughed and walked away.  Never going back.

18tlwD2yYL1Rn8aay9SOaA.text: Best Pho I've ever had!  I've eaten here weekly for a few years.  Large 22 cures any ailment!  Always great fresh sides for the soup.  Best iced tea in town.  It's got Jasmine and a ton of other flavors I love, but can't name.  Their fresh French bread is to die for along with their always crispy, piping hot egg rolls.

2jZHgSlMfjjhbsqjq9dbPw.text: Im a fan of the one on spring mnt but I thought I try this one. I must say the service was good and pleasant. The noodles were a bit over cooked and mushy but the pho was still good.

zVpeSc1WdId-_zw0pSGI-w.text: This place is just as good as the original one on Spring Mountain.  The good news for me is that it's right next to my office so I intend to sample everything off of their extensive menu instead of just the pho which I normally get.  Just in the last few weeks since it's opened I've tried some new stuff like the #2 veggie spring rolls which had some good tofu inside, #7 Banh Xeo which I really liked (its like putting a savory, greasy shrimp pancake inside a lettuce wrap and then adding fresh mint and dipping into sauce) and the #73 Bun Bo Hue which was a little underwhelming.    The manager, Eric, is really nice and helpful.  I will be going back again and again until I've tried it all!

2so-o3q-4NV8xqOaCG40ng.text: This is definitely a good second option for all of the east siders that can't make it to Chinatown for Vietnamese...  This is a True asian noodle shop...  much more focus on the food than the service.  Pho and spring rolls always tasty and come out quick, but definitely need to make eye contact with a server to get your check when you're finally done.

WgMz0iE0l82AMsbtqJXofA.text: Dude, anything with soup/broth, noodles, and filling is always good! Ive tried several pho dishes and their spring rolls.  I'm always full with the pho.  How do they slice beef so thin?  The pho broth is everything. It ties it all in.  Pho is a PIA to make if you don't have a pressure cooker.  I can appreciate the variety and toppings of pho. I literally can eat pho everynight.  I think when winter rolls around and the next time I catch a cold, I'll see if pho can be a good alternative for chicken soup.  I've been here several times already (yet I forget to check in!!!!) and will be back again when I'm itching for some Vietnamese goodness!

zTvtWvcR7a64Ly9zGnRkoA.text: This place has the right grilled pork dry vermicelli bowl that I like. I would suggest trying that dish here. Lemongrass has half the amount of the same dish, and this place makes it the way I like it. I'd recommended it to my friend, and he likes it too. Hopefully, it will get better.  I think we'll try Lemongrass Cafe next time...

c2VWT3MV5xnPrBa5-odYvw.text: It's hard for me to find a different pho place besides this one. I love this place, not only because of their food and warm delicious bowls of grilled shrimp vermicelli, or soup with the greatest rare steaks, but also because this place is so clean. The dishes and the small little sauce bowls are clean, their chopsticks are probably the best disposable chopsticks I've ever seen at a pho place, and the spoons are also clean. B70EHCGOisoW2JUXiyuMWw.text: HORRIBLE service. The only reason I gave two stars was because the food was pretty darn great. I had dinner here with my mom and the whole time the waitress and waiter (we were served by both) had an attitude and were rushing us. The waiter asked for our order as soon as they handed us the menu and we asked for a few minutes. He came back two minutes later and asked for our order and again we asked for a few more minutes because there's like a thousand items on the menu and it was my first time there. We finally ordered and the waitress came out and brought our food since our waiter was on his break having his meal at the table in front us us. We had the pho ga, shrimp spring rolls, and shrimp fried rice. Everything was absolutely delicious! When we asked the waitress for another order of shrimp spring rolls, she brought them back to us in a to-go box. I guess she wanted us to leave so we left since we were done with their crap. This place really needs to work on their customer service. The entire time both waiters had an attitude and a mad look on their face. I am a very polite customer and great tipper everywhere I go but I didn't leave a damn thing here. I'm never going back there again.

kBm6LECkaZTpPrGj4n86MA.text: I am giving a one star for bad experience with the staff and not the food. Happened to be there during lunch from work and decided to experiment with seafood and shrimp pho(#43). The food when it came to the table smelled completely off and rotten that even turned a few heads from neighboring tables. On complaining to the server about the foul taste and requesting to change the dish, they blatantly refused. I told them that I had not tried the dish, and the smell told the entire story. They refused a refund or change to a different dish, and had me reorder a second dish and pay for both.  This is one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant considering I eat out at least once a day. They have probably lost more than one customer today as the friends who were with me were baffled at this as well and have decided not to go back to the place.

axwWFmRE9AngR6b_a8gPNA.text: This is the best pho in town. Their broth is always on point! Service is fast, even when it gets busy. The quality of foods is always high. RkQOhWloKnBYB286tf7otg.text: I've ate here a few times. The service gets worse each time. This past trip we noticed the broth had an overload of MSG in the Pho. It's bad when you can notice it! Find a different option for pho, this place is a major bust!!

C2q8-dcrqDTDBkHgsj1nGw.text: I have been going to this restaurant for quite a while and the soup is good. I find that sometimes the waiters are jerks ... And they are not honest or they don't understand you! I ordered a small bowl of soup today and got a small soup ... I have been going there long enough to tell the difference (even though sometimes it is hard to tell). When I walked up to the register the guy charged me for a large one ... After arguing with him as to what I ordered and what I got, he took two steps to the side checked my table and said yeah that's a big one ... I walked back there and took a big one from another table and put it next to it, he still charged me for a big one. It is a dollar, I don't want to argue with stupid people but I won't go there again. Way to go playing with a customer that was there at least once a week ! Finding another place right now ...

20iDGbFY2P627tUIdkGiOw.text: People rave about this place. After having tried a Ramen place the night before in China Town, I thought this place was just OK, at best.  Service was very slow, they squashed us in a side table even though there were plenty of other seats, and didn't really explain WTF we were supposed to be doing.  For instance, I guess you are supposed to be wrapping the egg rolls in the large pieces of lettuce they give you??? They give you a BUNCH of stuff to doctor up your soup with, which I guess should've been my first indication that it wasn't going to be all that good.  DON'T GET THE MEATBALLS. They were nasty. Apparently, there's some confusion on meatballs and sausage in a casing?  You literally had to bite and tear into these packets of meat to get a chunk off of them. It definitely reminded me of eating an overcooked piece of sausage and way too big to be eating in one bite.  The Thai Tea was amazing but I felt for it's size, extremely over priced. In fact, the whole thing was a bit overpriced, it was almost $40 for 3 of us for lunch without tip. Trying to get the check was a production too, then paying the check up at the front, then tipping was all very strange.  I think we all agreed we don't have to go back.

7ck3E1Qw5HCJrJh_B0D43A.text: The cure for the common cold can be found here inside a steaming bowl of pho!  I have been a bit under the weather lately so my boyfriend took me here because I was craving some soup.  They were pretty busy even for a Thursday night.  It's located in the same parking lot as LVAC so I think that could explain the lack of parking.  When we walked in, it was packed so we had to wait a little bit.  We ordered the crispy egg rolls as an appetizer to share.  He ordered the Pho Tai Nam Gau Gan Ve Don Noodle soup with rare eye round steak, flank, brisket, soft tendon & skirt flank; and I ordered Pho Chin Bo Vien Noodle soup with well done lean meat & beef meatballs.  The food came out pretty fast, but once we got our food, it seemed a bit difficult to flag someone down when we wanted to pay.  That's when we found out that you just go to the counter and tell them your table number.

2dYyeGCf640lJAf5v3366w.text: Ph Saigon 8 on Eastern Ave is a great little ph spot. Consistently good food. Quick to get you seated, served, fed, and on your way. Not as fancy as some places you'll find in Chinatown, but what they lack in decor will be made up for with great service. Most ph shops pump so many people through them that even if you frequent them 1-2x per week (like I tend to) they never bother to treat you like a regular or give too much effort. To most restaurants you're just another hungry mouth to feed and get a tip from. Not Ph Saigon 8! They recognize you, give a friendly and sincere greeting, try their best to remember what you like and how you like it (shout out to my boy Thi). Service matters...and this place has that down!

rYqTm8wnsF5P2wegIExqig.text: I love this place! I've tried many pho restaurants in town, and I end up coming back to this one. But that won't stop me from coming here since the food is yummy! I always get an order of Fresh Spring Rolls and Combination Pho #18 with no eye round/no cilantro. I'm not a fan of the sweeter side pho broth. Their broth has a more savory taste to it which I like. The spring rolls have a good crunch from the shredded lettuce and they don't skimp on the meat unlike other restaurant do. The restaurant also offers other great food options like grilled pork with rice and combination fried rice that are very delicious as well. If you're around Henderson/SE Las Vegas area, give this place a shot!

I didnt have the pho so maybe I'm unfairly judging but the spring rolls had lettuce that you buy at the grocery store, rice noodles, and some tofu. That's it! Where's the cilantro? 7lPKQmaOVaSVNKUzGqI9ng.text: I have been going to Pho Saigon since last year. It's pretty close to where I live and only a walk away from LVAC.  I usually order the same thing -- a small bowl of their number 18 pho. Service is generally okay. I usually get my food about 10 minutes or less after putting in my order. I have tried their fresh spring rolls, they're not bad, though their sauce could use some improvement. They also do to-go orders, but I'm not sure about phone orders.  Ambiance is like your usual asian restaurant, although no matter how many times I have been there, I just can't recall whether they had music or not. It's also good for family, they can push tables together to accommodate a large party, and I think they have a different section for larger parties too.  I wish they had some kind of promo or discount for frequent customers. I'll be back again when my tummy craves for pho.

Wyhdo1Mcfr_rP5a7TeLxMw.text: I am very disappointed at this restaurant. This spot used to be my favorite pho place. Today I ordered banh Xeo for appetizer, hu tieu and pho for entrees. Somehow, the hu tieu and pho came out first before the appetizer. We asked if it was a mistake and the waiter told us that because the banh xeo takes a long time so it had to come after the entrees. I got confused because the appetizer should come before the main entrees. Anyway, the wait for it was not worth it. The banh xeo was dry , cold, and not crispy. The hu tieu was salty but luckily their pho is still decent. I am not sure I will come back anytime soon.

aAoLQU4612podPooq_CzeA.text: Close to our home, so I had to try it. Great little place tucked away on Eastern near Pebble. The food is flavorful and it's always busy during lunch. You have to come early to get a good seat. Would have given them a 5-star but the service needs an upgrade. They were quick with the food order and food delivery but that's about it. Needless to say, it's close and the food is wonderful and the portions are large.

sS2SG2Uwx8XPHblUO0fkOQ.text: This used to be our go to spot for pho, especially when the whole family is in town, but we took about a yearlong hiatus after we had a couple of bad experiences with service and decided to head down the street for our Vietnamese. We came back recently and the food was good and the service was better because we went during a non peak time. It will usually be busy when you go in, and because of this, service can be inattentive. Generally, your server will also be curt with you, that's the way they always have been and I don't see that changing anytime soon.  The pho here is consistently good. Everyone in my family, except for a select few, always order pho. I usually get #16 (I am not going to remotely attempt to spell any of the dishes) which is rare eye round, flank, and brisket. They'll bring you as much of the accouterments needed for your soup also. Even though it doesn't take them long to bring out your bowl once you order, you can tell the broth has been cooking for hours. The deep beef flavor is easily detectable along with the aroma of spices like star anise and clove. A big squeeze of sriracha for heat is the only other thing that I usually add to my soup.  I have had a few of their rice plates and they are satisfactory. The kids will always want an order of shredded pork spring rolls to start and they usually don't last too long. Pricing is affordable, usually right around $$ per person depending how many large bowls and sodas are ordered. Heads up also, check your bill before you pay because they'll tack on 15% gratuity for your party (it may be posted on a small sign in the front) and not say a word when they give you the check or after you've signed off on an extra 20% tip. Ultimately it's our fault for not looking over the check, but you're welcome Pho Saigon 8.  The pho is good enough to keep us coming back occasionally, but not good enough to overcome the service to make us regular visitors.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #16 Noodle with rare round eye, flank, and brisket

UOD7TcOTJhkoUd3AC2ewhA.text: Vietnamese BBQ  Shrimp Vermicelli or Bun Tom topped with grilled pork (thit),  is my favorite Vietnamese dish!   I love Vietnamese bun because it's not only tasty, but very healthy as it's not greasy and comes with all sorts of vegetables and herbs. Every bite is refreshing and appetizing; a noodle dish that is both filling and satisfying. Most people who have tried Vietnamese food are familiar with Pho, unfortunately for me it's fun to say but not to eat, I've just never had a taste for it.  So, if you're like me and have family and friends who dig Pho give this dish a try.  You're welcome!  And don't forget the Thai tea with boba.

But no, this bishhh ended up leaving the bathroom with her unwashed hands. I also notice a few servers do the same. I am calling the Health Department soon!

5yN1mF-A9-DmYsipZriw4w.text: This is my second time here. The Pho isn't bad, however I've had better. I was disappointed in that I couldn't order the combination of meats I prefer like most pho places. Like most of these restaurants they do not give military or student discounts.

2Ycav-d-HRRV9czveqXDkw.text: This place is sooooo good, wooohooohooo from today forward this will be my neighborhood PHOvorite place to have my soup. It should be PHO you too. This PHOlace can be pack so plan your trip here, it can be very busy during lunch and dinner time but not bad you can be seated pretty fast. :)

lhgWMqOY4ruMFa_19mVY6w.text: Atrocious service. Seriously the worst. Bad attitudes, grim faces. The food is good if you can get someone to serve you. No welcome. No greeting. No thank you. They make you feel like a burden. Deserve zero stars but the food is good enough if you're desperate and patient

ppnI9or1h4mEDwytQdKv-A.text: My boyfriend and I look forward to eating here every time we crave Pho, it's definitely our go to. They're knowledgeable and speedy! Love it!

0mFiBVm-jb2quXFNReniTw.text: So I had pho once in my life, it was seafood, I didn't like it and that was back in California. I, in my never ending quest to "try new things" went out for Vietnamese with my sister after coming up empty at Whole Foods.   I've passed by this place a million times and have wanted to try it. Again, even if I don't like something the first time, I try to try it in a different preparation again at another time. We walked inside, it was nice, clean, and we were seated promptly. My sister decided she wasn't hungry and didn't want to try anything so she ordered a side of rice. I ordered a #73 (I have no idea what the real name was.) The description said it was spicy. The waitress told me it had pig's blood in it. Was I a little hesitant, yeah, but I ordered it anyway.  My sister's rice was delivered to our table in about 2 seconds, along with the mint and lettuce for my pho. About 5 minutes later, the soup came out. I was completely unfamiliar with the two gray black cubes of ??? and the white pate like half circle floating on the side. Apparently, according to the waitress, it was pig's blood sausage and another type of sausage. I had to skip the blood sausage. I couldn't bring myself to try it. The pork in it, well, I couldn't identify what part of the animal it was from. The fat was very rare.   Was the soup spicy? No. I had to add a ton of siracha to my soup, along with the jalapenos. Would I go there again? Maybe, but I would for sure try something else. What I ordered was not something that had a lot of depth of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #73 with pork, sausage, and blood sausage. 6/16/11
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My sister and her huge side of rice with no soy sauce. 6/16/11
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #73 with pork, sausage, and blood sausage. 6/16/11

OzyYQFrQZ6HJWNncmeafWw.text: I would have to say one of the best places to get Pho. I get the #11 mostly.  It's soo yummy. I would have to say the service isn't the best, but the last couple of times I have been here its getting better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Number 11

tzJ1IC81XMzU8F5bBT7Njg.text: I know what I am getting every time I go.  I used to frequent the Spring Mountain location for like 10 years.  This one is much more convenient off the 215.  I even go alone if I am in the mood for Pho!

TWG-nBHEWfcF-KOYI0fvxw.text: In my top 5 places to eat Pho. Not number 1, but it is most definitely up there. The service is good and the seating is fast. I will come again.

f70Vh3pHucsqEGDjwNZfTw.text: Had fresh roll. A little bland and dry. The Pho w beef brisket and ribeye was decent. Broth had decent flavor and portion size was well worth the $10. Service was very quick to deliver the food and slow to deliver the check. I think some people's complaints about rude service may be a misunderstanding of the culture and also due to a language barrier. But who knows. It's not overly friendly there but it's a strip mall restaurant and they're busy. I went in to eat and I got hot, decent food so I'm happy. If you're looking for a dinning experience that's going to change your life this isn't the place. If your looking for a decent and hot meal at a fair price then this is it. Definitely will be back. Only 4 stars because I've had better Pho but it's still good and well worth the price.

TnQ4GCcQAv874OgtvlTFwg.text: Good authentic Vietnamese food. They get busy so order ahead for pick up. I get the pho dac biet and the pork chop with rice. So yummy! Egg rolls are good too. I come back often and would recommend this place to anyone.

f41cjU6HTCwAQo0cvgeBzg.text: I'm glad I tried Pho Saigon 8.  I ordered the pho with round, flank and meatball, but asked to replace the flank with brisket, and I'm not sure which I got, but it was inedible -- way too fatty and chewy.  Luckily, there were only 2 small slices of it, and plenty of the other 2 meats, so now I know -- next time I'll stick with the round and meatballs.   The basil and sprouts that came with the pho were THE FRESHEST I've seen at any pho restaurant, with no brown spots on the basil, and no yellow tinge on the sprouts.  I started with the BBQ pork rolls, which are like spring rolls but with pork instead of shrimp.  At first, I thought the meat was Spam, but it wasn't salty enough, more like thick bologna.  I've had pork rolls elsewhere where the meat was recognizable.  The peanut sauce for the rolls was thin, and not as flavorful as I'd like.  I tried a drink made of raw egg white, seltzer and condensed milk, and it was delicious.  The staff was good -- some were friendly and others were serious, but the service was excellent.

p2v3Plo7G15tBYFXF5VYDQ.text: Delicious chicken breast pho, Scrumptious delicious appetizers, no crazy hovering from the servers and an efficient checkout process with the cashier. Who could ask for more?. Plus the broth is the bomb!

YLCldcWtCK2Dl6y6noe4Ug.text: Best Pho place in Henderson but they raised their price.  Their bbq meat is very well marinated and delicious.  3 stars for being too expensive and we had to keep asking for water.

DaBC-dg2JJWN6DqhhUfowA.text: I live by little Saigon in southern California and we always come here when we're in Vegas. They have friendly staff and their food is great. I always order the bun bo hue. It's spicy and loaded with meat! The pho is great as well. They don't disappoint.

tBnI2Dva8KgzUjimhRfnUA.text: I'm not really a Pho eater. I don't eat meat. My friend wanted Pho so we went to this place.   It was my first time here. Inside looked like a typical Vietnamese restaurant with a silk flower decor thing going on. As you enter there's a little waterfall pond with good luck coins that people tossed in and an offering of Rambutan fruits near by.  I look over menu and have questions.  This young girl comes to our table. I ask her (pointing to the picture) does this have meat in it? She replies, huh? I ask again. She replies, egg roll. I say, right, does it have meat? She replies, meat and points to shrimp roll.  She stared at me with a puzzled look. Then my friend said, can you bring someone here who speaks English.   This guy comes over. I ask about egg roll and shrimp roll. He said they can make both without meat, they add tofu. I said great. A different guy came by to take our order. I ordered the tofu roll and I wanted egg roll without meat. The guy tells me, no we cannot make that without meat, it's premixed. Huh? I'm like, ok whatever. Then the guy points to a picture of vermicelli noodle with tofu and veggies. I told him ok I'll try it.  Food was good! I really enjoyed the tofu with vermicelli noodles and veggies, round onion, peanuts and fish sauce on the side. It was very tasty. The tofu was fried in a sweet marinade. The tofu roll was delicious too. My friend enjoyed her pho with beef brisket and egg rolls.   Overall food was good. Ambience ok. Service was ok. I will definitely come back here to eat again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu w/ vermicelli noodles, veggies, peanuts &amp; round onion w/ side fish sauce
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The garden of vegetables w/ egg roll.
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho beef brisket.

0moNNcYByNWNJCo1QWbOow.text: Good Viet food here!   I wasn't expecting the high quality and authentic food in this town but it was actually pretty good. Prices are super fair and it seemed to be a popular place for lunch on a weekday. Try something new - banh xeo was also decent. I am comparing everything to my momma's homemade food so it can't compare but for the location, I would recommend this place if you are in the area and are looking for a Vietnamese restaurant with a big selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Ai7oxUVTd7Gxel1NnMr_w.text: Pho Saigon 8 boasts a lovely interior that has clearly been renovated. Service was decent.  The menu was extensive and prices fair.  I ordered a small pho and the broth was tasty. I was actually quite full so took fewer bites than expected of a rice dish that I had ordered as well (with intentions to have leftovers anyway for lunch at work).  The spring rolls were also tasty as an appetizer and contained both shrimp and pork.  Overall, food was tasty and ambience nice = solid Vietnamese restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls.
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho #18.
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior.

_IC8stjZeCHPYFXTFJFdxA.text: First of all, let me give you my credentials on reviewing Vietnamese food: I'm half-Vietnamese, born and raised in Vegas, been to every pho place in that last few decades. Pho Saigon 8 on Eastern is by far one of the BEST pho's in Vegas!! The broth is on point. The vegetables (mint, bean sprouts, lettuce) are always fresh and abundant (lots of pho restaurants have wilted veggies). The meat is fresh and abundant as well.   I've been coming here for years, and recently, over the last couple years, they have been upgrading the decor, furniture and overall cleanliness of this location. So now, not only is the pho amazing, the restaurant environment is being transformed. The owner is making the right choices.   Service is good. But beware, if your used to the American way of service, this is not it. At a Vietnamese restaurant, they are all about efficiency. The quickly take your order, and in minutes you start receiving your food. Which is good, because if you have little kids and babies, the wicker the better.   My favorite pho is #16 which is rare meat, flank and brisket. Most people get the Pho Tai (not sure what number that is). And make sure to get the fried egg rolls, they make it just like my mom makes them.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New clean booth benches
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Added large screen TVs for those who like that sort of thing
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New trendy light fixtures

50U0YBhdmgxSrdvfwTHVZQ.text: I've been coming here going on 10 years now.  When I first moved to Vegas, I did a huge search for the best pho and this place was it.  Luckily, I lived in Henderson at the time so I ended up here a lot.  No matter where I lived, I ended up coming here for pho.  When my family moved to Vegas, they started to come here as well.  There have been a lot of swings in terms of what rating I'd give this place.  10 years ago, it was 5 for food, 3 for ambiance.  5 years ago, 4 for food and 2 for ambiance.  Today, 3 or food and 4 for ambiance.    Steady decline in terms of food quality but the remodel has made the place look more modern and really nice.  I still think the broth here is fantastic but I noticed the meat is not so nice anymore.    The egg rolls are still amazing but the spring rolls... not so much.    The service is exactly the same.  A lot of attention at first but once you get your food, you'll be lucky if you can even flag anyone down for anything.

BSktOZ7r6cX3rJ0xOJYvLQ.text: This pho is okay , it's not that good need to make it better with there ingredients! It taste oily and watery . Customer service is good

USvxau97DQr2S7a-AfIT9w.text: I'm not sure as to why this place has such "low star ratings." Stopped in earlier for a late lunch with a couple girlfriends and since this place came highly recommended by my homegirl, I was looking forward to my Pho Saigon 8 experience! We were seated right away, during the busy lunch hour - which was a great sign because we were hangry.   The overall ambiance was nice; the restaurant was clean and they already had hot sauces and condiments on the tables which was nice. There's nothing like having to constantly ask for seconds and thirds for hot sauce, so much easier when they have it ready on the table :)   We placed our order and literally within minutes the server was at our table delivering our yummy hot pho soups! I thought it was the wrong table but noooo, it was our order. My immediate spoon full of broth was almost close to perfect. The broth is very, very flavorful with just the perfect amount of temperature. My thin pieces of beef had a thin border of fat, just the way I love it. The noodles were a different kind of texture that I'm used to, but I'm not complaining - the pho here is delish!

fj9r-yjA5QzyzBd3ubQlNg.text: Me and two friends arrived and were seated within 5 minutes. It wasn't busy so that might be the reason why but overall the service was VERY fast and I was pleased. After we got seated we got our order taken within 5-7 minutes. All of our food arrived very quickly as well. Took less than 10 minutes for our order to be ready. Not only was the service fast, but the food was really good.  I got the number 16 and an order of egg rolls. I am a huge fan of pho and this pho was very good. The restaurant itself is very nice as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L4Y0uU2IWO4iXAPP63QaLA.text: Bomb..! great services for labor Weekend people We're so nice, fast service, high quality Vietnamese food. place inside is small but they're good to handle the traffic My girlfriend and I enjoyed this place. thank you Pho Saigon.

UEi0QNlwESM1yqt7Hmv5sQ.text: This is a usual spot for my coworkers and I for lunch. We've been coming here for the past 3-4 years or so.   -They have good pho, chicken pho especially. I have found a lot of pho places have bland chicken pho or the chicken isn't good -On the contrary, their chicken that comes with the bun is pretty rubbery and dry...  -They have good eggrolls

BoGbBdAqL22-BMDoOjvSsA.text: In Pho, just our opinion but,  it's all about the broth. Here they have some of the best we have tasted so far. The fried egg rolls were excellent also. The pinch bowls were very fresh. Don't be alarmed, the food comes out to you  very fast, almost scary, but it's fresh and delicious. Service was great.

WFooBM_iWgRE1TVxeCyk7A.text: What will it take to get this place to realize this is Vegas, you as a restaurant, survive on customer service!! Get it together, the waiter so so but Lordy the woman at the register was a Bitch. Never again will I give them my m

xttjbdNQkeUu75oAC5vU7Q.text: This has always been my to go Pho place. Their food options are delicious and their service is good.  I tried the beef pho, it was amazing. For appetizers, we had the egg rolls and the shrimp spring roles. I also had the coconut which was amazing. You can't go wrong with any item on the menu. They have booth seating which I like and all the the staff is Vietnamese, which makes it more authentic.

PhKRG5T8_C-gsV94x5X9YA.text: Off to the side of the freeway is little Pho Saigon 8. I wanted to give this place a chance because I read a lot of positive reviews. Needless to say, I was a little disappointed with the pho here. Also, I wasn't sure if the staff working there were actually Vietnamese or not. Going off what most people were raving about, I went with the pho ga and my friend did a pho tai gan (tendon). The consistency of the noodles were mushy and soft, which is not how I would normally eat my pho. The chicken also didn't come with any dipping sauce, and the broth after awhile gave me a slight headache. The beef pho was all right, nothing special. My expectations for pho are pretty low in Nevada, but this particular restaurant was just lacking so much.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho ga (thigh)

_S1QwRVapN86xvJNynW5iA.text: At the intersection of 215 & Eastern. Came here a couple of days after a less-than-thrilling experience at "Pho Little Saigon," just on the other side of 215 from this venue.   Saturday night around 7pm, this space was packed. I snagged the last table. Based on the ravings of other Yelpers, I ordered without consulting the menu: egg rolls app & a small chicken pho. Amazingly, my entire dinner - the egg rolls presented with romaine lettuce, the pho, a plate of bamboo shoots, everything - was on my table in just under five minutes.   The egg rolls were mid-sized and pretty good, even though they came in at about $6.50 for a plate of four. I usually do spring rolls, here they are a plate of two large for about $5.50.  This was pretty good pho. For a small, the portion was very generous, both the chicken and the noodles. The white meat chicken was OK but not especially flavorful. To be expected: to be served so fast, the broth already-done must just catch the chicken dropped-in. Some salt & pepper would have helped the chicken itself, but there was none on the table (there was rooster sauce, tho.) The broth was pretty tasty, not off the charts, but good. Next time, I will try a beef pho to test what should be a more savory broth.   The initial service, as I said, was fast. After that, my table was pretty much forgotten. I caught a beverage refill as one wait made a pass. Other than that, I never saw anyone again, though I wanted for more napkins. I noted another table that also had to flag down staff for their needs.  With tax, before beverage and tip, this meal was $16.56 out-the-door. And I was still hungry.   Next time, I'll go with the large pho - and skip the pricey appetizer. I didn't notice any lunch specials being pushed ... but I bet there are. I'll try for that and see what gives.

Y-hnUuolpp-PV8FfEfc5Rg.text: Amazing best pho in Vegas hands down love the fried rice spring rolls an the pho  Tried a few other places but by far the best and only place I go

UTAG-yRqxgezV89-qEGqOQ.text: I'm surprised to see this place has 3 1/2 stars. I thought the staff was friendly and fast. I always order the vegetable pho when I am trying to avoid meats but still get a flavorful meal. They're super accommodating and add a nice mix of veggies. The prices are decent and it's conveniently located right off the 215. Even when they're busy for lunch, it's not too long of a wait.  Would recommend :)

x2r4NQONj45NT3PixDUJMQ.text: I have to say I was very disappointed with the food here. Nothing really for vegans. My girlfriend who is Vietnamese was also disappointed with the flavors and the soup broth. Tasteless. She did let them know that they need improvement with flavors of food and vegan options. I'll put a picture up of banh xeo with not much to it. Still looking for yummy pho restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banh xeo. Thumbs down.
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banh xeo. Thumbs down.
