KtbaqDRee9Srz6Y91QakNQ.text: They have vegan options!! Went there for the 2nd time today with a large group and everything was fantastic. Everybody in the group are meat/seafood eaters and I'm the only vegan so we chose this place because of that.  #29 is he vegetable Pho and tell them that you want vegan so they can use a vegetable broth. The bowl comes out loaded with veggies and tofu and with all the additional toppings they provide you to adjust to your liking, its delicious! I ordered the large and ate the entire bowl and they have tofu spring rolls (I think #3). Service was quick and friendly and we'll definitely return.  #29 vegan Pho #3 vegan spring rolls Great quick service

q5LYQNoe7CJx6PbJUXYPPw.text: Overall: Pho Saigon 8 disappoints in making its namesake dish, but the Hu Tieu was pretty dang good. It might be my regular for that dish, but I'll have to continue looking for a pho restaurant.  Food: 3  Pho Chin (Cooked Brisket): The broth lacked the intense umaminess from beef bones, but it was clear and not too sweet. However, the brisket was completely dry and tasteless.  Hu Tieu My Tho Kho: Surprisingly, this dish was good. The sauce was well balanced and flavorful. There was plenty of sauteed ground pork and offals, and the shrimps were a good size. They aren't too consistent on the offals as one bowl had almost all heart while the other had a mix of heart and liver. Make sure to ask for the hu tieu giay!  Service: 3  We didn't have too many interactions with the waiters outside of ordering and asking for a few extra things.  As a California native from Little Saigon, I'm used to ordering in Vietnamese in Vietnamese restaurants. However, I'm not sure if all the waiters here speak Vietnamese fluently because our waiter seemed to have a hard time understanding my order.  Ambiance: 4  Pho Saigon 8 is a small restaurant, so the tables are kind of close together. But it's decently clean and cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Chin (Cooked Brisket)

dqwM9yyPSV8aUrxe0Zk51w.text: boy is it cold out in vegas tonight.. stopped in here with the parentals to get warm and toasty.. i rarely eat anything else than seafood pho.. so tonight i got the small #44 which only consists or shrimp and crab! the other place i usually eat pho at in the bay area has more seafood items in the meal but since those are my top 2 favorite things.. it sounded like the perfect bowl! my choice of beverage tonight was their fresh squeezed lemonade!  food came out in a timely manner.. and everything looked delish.. i loved how i ordered a small but they gave me noodles as it was a large! i was totally expecting imitation crab.. and to my surprise there was real crab meat.. couldn't get better than that! shrimp was kinda bland but nothing that sriracha sauce can't fix! taste, size, temperature of the whole thing was wonderful.. just what i needed for a cold night! my lemonade was bomb! i usually don't care for tart sour drinks but i must say this was some good as lemonada! so refreshing to the mouth after a hot meal! i shall come here many more times in the future!   oh the bad..  not so many parking spaces for the little shoppping area its in.. seating arrangements kinda suck.. service was ok.. but they could try to come around a little more often.. and when the bill came back swiped and all.. they didn't have a customer copy receipt.. only store copy.. i personally don't care for that extra piece of paper but many do!  oh did i mention there's a yogurtland next door.. :)

73kxMpOslK-5PCiiQex-Dg.text: i always visit the location on spring mtn.  since i was in the mood for pho on 215 i decided to try it.  let's just say i would rather go back to spring mtn.  this location on eastern has the rudest employees and to top it all off the egg rolls they served were stale.  never again

CetcoVFooBn10bSS6APfJA.text: im giving it a 4 because the bun bo hue is fucking great. thats the only reason why i go there. i bring my own bottled water cuz I know im not getting refilled. uhm. customer serive throw that shit out the door. and I'm not vietnamese but for all the yuppies out there thinking your gonna get great service from a vietnamese restaurant, you might want to think again. the pho. not very good at all. but what ever. i give it a 4 because i get what i want and its inexpensive.

JidlNtCxLEI_mWtLqSRJLA.text: I have been here twice.  The service is quick, the food is cheap and tasty, but both times I ate here it made me sick.  Too bad :(

FYi-jWCcivmVnE5afXBrWw.text: This is by far my favorite lunch place.  I love the soup - no matter what I have, it's always good!  It's a great comfort food, especially when the weather gets cold or rainy or if I'm feeling under the weather.  I start everything with an order of spring rolls, best shared with a friend.  So fresh!  Then order whatever soup that fancies me that day.  Make sure to order a SMALL because the LARGE is enough to share!  If I have room after eating all of that, I love to get a hot vietnamese coffee with that yummy cream.   So good!

dRcaXpmUwO9EI8gtfdexiA.text: I have been to this place about 3 times now.  Place is almost always packed.  Food is great and service can improve.  It is good place to go for 1.5hrs lunches.  :)   Fresh rolls are awesome here and so is the beef stew!

Bg4wA3RlOpOYC5m72BKWvw.text: i like this place!  a good pho place is hard to find, and when I get a craving for good pho, this is definitely the spot.      the variety is awesome, and they offer rice plates as well.  the grilled pork is good.. and the seafood pho is a favorite.  we always get the eggrolls as an appetizer and it comes with fresh lettuce and cilantro to wrap them in.   the waiters are friendly... and always good about answering my questions and getting our order right.    i agree with the other reviews that say your practically sitting in your neighbors laps... but its usually packed so it's not a surprise that they try and accommodate a lot of ppl.  but the pho is the best i've had in vegas so far, so when it's pho the fam wants, it's saigon 8 they'll get!

Wf8Rc6cONEoiEID46AzS7Q.text: I've only been once, it was good pho, pretty cheap, and reasonably fast. I wouldn't say it was anything spectacular but worth it if you're in the mood.

tF11GU8N1Dul-lUTq1Kegw.text: This used to be our fav Pho place, even if its out of the way for us in Henderson, clean and new shop. Sadly the service is just bad. There is a "bigger" gal that works behind the counter, and has the "shoot me now, I hate my job" attitude. There is one lady who does get customer service and does a good job taking care of customers, but she is not always there. The Pho broth is clean, not greasy, and the noodle + protein amount is generous.  Prices seem a tad higher than most places in the Valley, but I dont think we will be going much anymore.

4rSYCfnt2EnYFAM8l5ntow.text: It was better when they opened, but now I'd rather drive the half hour to get service.   The food quality varies on time of day or time that you show up.  As the day draws to a close, the broth resembles water and salt thrown in a bowl with oil.  But as the others said, service is in the pits.  Once we were seated and they completely forgot to take our order for like 15 minutes-then we left.  Be sure to order two drinks and water for yourself, because once they throw you food  on your table they'll never check up on you.     Also the tables are cramped so close together so if you and the person scoot your seats together, you'd practically be siamese twins.

N1FIXW4uvHcHnQogq-MgCg.text: My two boys love this place. We always order the pho, Thai tea, and egg rolls. The service is fast, but not very friendly. It's a small restaurant with tight seating, a bit uncomfortable. The soup isn't usually hot enough to my liking, but temp is good for the kids. I hate the fact that they never bring you an itemize check, so you have to trust them. Mmmm...I don't think so! The floor is a bit slippery so don't wear your cute heels you might eat it. Also they don't have fountain soda, only cans (just saying). All in all decent restaurant, close to home, fast unfriendly service, tight seating (you might even make a new friend, not by choice), food is consistant, don't order soda (can) or drink the water (gross), have them give you and itemize check or repeat back your order when paying, if the soup isn't hot enough send it back, and wear shoes with grips so you won't fall on your ass. ENJOY! :)

diftUd8CsS0R6y9_VusNSQ.text: Maybe not the best PHO I've had but definitely decent and worth trying! I'll be frequenting this joint for take-out since it satisfies my cravings for Vietnamese food. The place itself is very clean, modern, and service is pretty darn good. It's a comfortable environment and it's not in Spring Mountain mixed in the cluster of Asian restaurants. That's a plus! Oh, and the menu is pretty comprehensive so you'll find something!

cuI9_n97bBKrLH3uPz3xgg.text: Let it be said that there is absolutely nothing horrible about this place.  Everything is just mediocre.    First, the decor was the best thing about it.  It was new, well-painted, pretty paintings and new chairs and tables with granite on top.  There were nice fake plants on the ceilings and walls, and the bathroom was clean, and nice.  The problem is that the tables had this bar under them where my friend kept hitting his knees against.  The tables were set so close together that I could probably have reached over to the other table and stolen a spring roll off of it.  Speaking of the spring rolls, they were just not good.  The flour sheets on the spring rolls were chewy, and they did not have that nice crunchy stuff in the center that tastes really good, like the ones at Lemongrass.  The dipping sauce was good, but not exceptional.  The pho was the biggest let-down today.  Pho Saigon 8 on Spring Mountain had rich, full broth, that seemed just a little too fatty, and was very good.  This one was rather thin, and its flavor was easily masked by any of the things that you could put in it.  For example, more basil meant that the pho tasted like basil and not pho.  Add bean sprouts, and the pho tasted like water and not much else.  The meat was good, though, and they put a liberal amount of green onion, which I always like.  I also tried the lemon soda.  This was a very good soda, although it was much too sweet.  I think it could have benefited from having more lemon flavor and less sugar in it.    They have no sandwiches.    In addition, everything there is smaller, and/or more expensive than Lemongrass, right across the street.  For example, the large pho was the same price for both, but the bowl is smaller was easily finished by myself and my friend.  We've almost never finished a large pho at Lemongrass.  The Vietnamese seafood crepe was both smaller *and* more expensive, by as much as $0.50-$1.00, and while good, made me a little skittish about ordering it again.  The Spring Rolls were the same price, but came with only two instead of three like at Lemongrass.    Much as I want to see more pho places around, I simply cannot recommend this place with Lemongrass Cafe so close to it.  Maybe if it was in the middle of rural Nevada with no other competition, it would have impressed me more.  I'm sorry, Pho Saigon 8 :/

cyyawgPKJnusNADcQWN9cA.text: Pho Saigon 8 is my favorite Vietnamese place in Vegas. Although I prefer the West side one on Spring Mountain because it allows a bit easier access with my wheelchair, I am glad that they are now present on the Eastside. A previous Yelper commented that the Lemongrass Cafe across the street is much better, but I have to disagree. Furthmore, the danky carpet in the other place ruins my appetite. Saigon 8 creates the best both for the phos everytime. According to a lot of my Vietnamese friends, it is created fresh every day. The summer rolls are always delicious and their peanut sauce is superb. When I need comfort food this is the place to be. I even feel guilty if I do not order my usual dishes.

uFLatMZziP15cHgoCoWxnA.text: Quick and friendly service! If you love spicy food, order #73 and add extra spicy paste they give you! Its really good! But I do wish that the bowls were bigger!

pI2x6oMHC2FPMrJTwcoQ3w.text: It was 8:30 p.m. on a cool Thursday evening. My daughter and I had just been in the neighborhood and thought about eating Pho. We had seen this restaurant many times as we drove by but never stopped in. I wish we never had. We walked in and there was no one in the establishment. One of the employees were cleaning the floors and chairs were pulled out from the tables. We asked if they were open and the owner waved us in and we sat. (They close at 10:00p.m.)The two flat screen tvs were off and it was very quiet....really quiet. We ordered a large pho tai and salt and pepper shrimp to share. The soup broth was not the best and you could see alot of oil floating on top and not to mention hardly any noodles. We were thirsty from the saltiness and needed a refill on water but all the employees and the owner were sitting down eating dinner. I had to get up and ask for service. Three other tables came in and were seated at 8:45pm. Once their food was delivered the employees once again sat at "their" table and continued eating. I had to stand up once again to ask for the check. I'm sorry I had not gone to Lemongrass Cafe to eat in the first place. We will never go back to this establishment. One more thing. As one of the employees brought our dish of the shrimp, he asked if we wanted rice (which comes with this order). We said yes and as he walked bakc to the kitchen, sneezed a very large, loud, yucky sneeze, we almost didn't want the rice!!!!! Gross!

vwmo-62vWfCKnR97895Opw.text: This place is super clean (major bonus points!) and they have great vegetarian pho. My husband and I each get a large bowl- it is huge and takes forever to eat!  Their fresh spring rolls (the cold ones) are good, but not the best i've had.  The sweet sauce that comes with them is great.  Major bonus points for a place that offers a veg pho on par with the traditional beef one!

AnVxXQyxhTNE1LxdVQFKQA.text: I've been to Pho Saigon 8 multiple times; there are a few pros and cons for me.  Pros: - Generous portions of Pho for low prices - Delicious, hearty broth; one of the better broths out of the Pho restaurants I've been to - Delicious Vietnamese fried egg rolls and rice paper spring rolls - Fast service   Cons: - Brisket is the only meat I ever order in my Pho and the brisket here is way too fatty. Each slice of brisket is over 50% fat. There's different kinds of fatty too but this one is ridiculously chewy. I spend more time dissecting my brisket than enjoying my soup.  - Sometimes the bean sprouts they bring out for your Pho looks and tastes old and withered  Anyway, the broth is amazing. If you order your pho and get meatballs, flank steak, rare beef, etc. I would definitely recommend coming here. If you like brisket though, try Pho Little Siagon across the street. Such tender beef brisket!

4Eks_wuAQfCBZlnyeCzE_Q.text: I do like this location simply because they do takeout and its nice to take my pho home. Admittedly they only get 4 stars because sometimes I've called in an order, they tell me it will be ten minutes and by the time I get there, my order is not ready nor does anyone seem to recall me having put one in. I go at least 3 times a month if I can. The males seem to do this more then the females working there. It has happened more then once and it does get annoying after awhile. It is also a hit or miss sometimes with the soup itself. There have been times I have gotten meat that appears a little off putting and I get sick after eating it. It's rare but it does happen.  Overall I enjoy coming here, as I can just pick up my soup after I get off work and go. Admittedly I wish they stayed open until 11 instead of ten like their spring mountain locations but otherwise no other complaints.

62yL8-c4sK647sEYGTP39A.text: First time to this place and was impressed. Super fast service and food was amazing can't wait to eat hear again.

kYJz6SS3E2Hc-cZdToAdtw.text: THIS IS THE BEST PLACE FOR PHO IN LAS VEGAS. Don't be fooled, they have another location on Spring Mtn Road in Chinatown, but this location in Henderson is much better.  For me pho comes down to 4 things.  1. the soup.  2. the noodles 3. the meat 4. cleanliness  The soup here is real, some places try to cut corners by not using real stock, they go with the "gaijing" or chicken/pork base, this saves hours of prep and time (and is cheaper) but the taste isn't there. If you want to know if real stock is being used, take a cup full home, put it in the fridge and if it has fat settled on the top in form of white dots, its the real deal. THIS PLACE USES REAL STOCK AND THE FLAVOR IS REALLY REALLY GOOD.  The noodles here are good, they don't give you a ton, so if you are a big eater like myself you can order extra, or load up on the sprouts and basil. I am 6'4 and push 300 lbs, this place fills me up with out extra noodles, mainly due to the generous portion of meat.  The meat here is perfect. IT IS CUT THIN!!! There are so many pho places that simply slice their meat too thick and it tastes chalky and hard to digest. Here they do it perfect. The rare eye of the round, brisket and fatty brisket are perfect. I get the #18 that comes with all the above with tendon and tripe.  You can tell this place is well taken care of. The hoisin sauce bottle is clean, the hot sauce container doesnt have 3 week old hot sauce jerky hanging from it (foodies will know what i mean) and the place is decorated nicely, service is fast and nice.  We live 2 mins from Chinatown but will travel 30 mins to Henderson to eat here. BEST PLACE FOR PHO IN LAS VEGAS, HANDS DOWN.

hSL8CXNAr86k5inIRAdqZg.text: Easily Pho-gotten Experience  Can't really comment on the sister restaurant in Spring Mountain, but I stopped by here since I currently reside on the east part of town and I wanted to check out the Las Vegas Athletic Club located not far behind.  A good way to judge a Vietnamese restaurant is the quality of the their beef pho broth.  While I was fairly hungry having scheduled a late lunch, I was both delighted and simultaneously skeptical regarding the fact that my steaming bowl of beef pho with flank steak and tendon came within 2 minutes of placing my order.  One of my Vietnamese friends taught me some easy signs to spot a good broth are through sight and smell prior to tasting.  One should detect an immediate aroma upon the bowl being placed at your table and I'm not sure if that was the case.  The clarity of the broth both in term of being able to visualize the ingredients and the absence of an abundance of oil at the surface also is a positive sign and this broth appeared to pass the sight test.   Poking my chopsticks around followed by adding the standard sides (sprouts, jalapenos, lime, and basil), I began to slurp and taste.  The noodles were the right texture and not overly clumped together, although this can be the most forgivable fault if all else is right.  The meat was problematic in that the thin slices were clumped together like miniature meat softballs and the only way of preventing any undercooked areas would be to OVERCOOK the whole mass.  Anthony Bourdain once commented in his book Kitchen Confidential that one should never order steak well done since you will likely get the worst cut of meat available since one cannot tell the difference between the best and worst when it is well done.  I feel the same holds True when you are trying to assess the quality of the thinly sliced beef in one's pho.  The tendon was actually the star in that they were sliced with a good combination of collagenous goodness and the occasional hint of meat and cooked to perfection.    Last but not least, the broth is what makes or breaks the dish, and in this case, my nose trumped my eyes in that the taste of the broth was fairly one-dimensional.   The broth is usually a matter of pride amongst Vietnamese moms and no two are alike since hours to days are spent perfecting the signature combination of beef bones, ginger, onion, and aromatics (cinnamon, anise. cloves, peppercorns, etc) guarded in households much like the Colonel Sanders' original recipe.  I could barely detect anything beyond a mild sweetness which could have been MSG or a bouillion cube (we'll see how thirsty I am a few hours from writing this review).  I am probably being overcritical since I have had some great broths in the past, so I will say that much like the clientele which was mostly of mixed caucasian/asian couples, this place would be a great primer for someone new to pho since I would think perhaps the addition of the other subtle flavors may weird out the newcomers and sometimes one has to sample an average broth to appreciate an excellent broth.    P.S.  Probably the only pet peeve of mine is avoid taking home noodle soups unless you plan on consuming them later that night.  It is a food crime to eat them as leftovers when the noodles have had a chance to get soggy and release their starches and muddle the broth.

They are really quick, you order and they bring it out within minutes.  The size large is super large though!  The decor is odd, but not bad for a Mom and Pop Shop atmosphere.  It is pretty cheap too, I think I spent $11.00 on mine for a large bowl and water to drink.  I really loved the fresh basil leaves, it was delicious.

2JMg-vhvxMGpPfLHxvbm3A.text: I may not be the biggest Vietnamese food fan.  The food was just ok.   Ambiance, eh, service and overall, just ok.

0Ytj19iEgIp7edxVQoZDcQ.text: I just got back from a two week trip to Vietnam and was excited to test out Pho Saigon 8 after reading some good reviews from John Curtis.    First, I noticed that some have complained about the service.  It's not prompt, or attentive, but trust me, that's authentic!  In Vietnam servers don't get tipped so they have no reason to be attentive, and there you have to ask for your check... So, if it really is Vietnamese staff working there, expect to have to request your check and realize that it's not rude to approach them.  Now for the food!  We ordered vegetarian spring rolls which were tasty, although they could have used some more herby additions.  The dipping sauce was delicious!  We split the Pho Tai (thin strips of beef in the beef pho broth).  The pho was good, not the best I've had, but a solid middle of the road.  It was pretty flavorful, add-ins are appropriate (giant basil, bean sprouts, hot peppers).  But, what impressed me was that they had the rice crepes that have become my favorite Vietnamese meal!  The crepe is made with rice flour (it's a savory crepe, folks), cooked in a pan until a bit crispy, and filled with bean sprouts, shrimp, and pork.  It comes with a fish sauce based dripping sauce that augments this dish wonderfully.  With this meal (which appears in the appetizer section, but I use as a main course) comes a giant plate of ruffage.  The proper execution is to take a lettuce leaf, cut off a chunk of the crepe + filling, and use the lettuce leaf as a wrap to make your own little spring roll out of it.  Add in the carrot, some kind of other root vegetable, and mint that they provide.  The rolls are cool and crunchy on the outside, warm, crunchy, and flavorful on the inside.  Don't forget the dipping sauce, it's well worth it.  Most Vietnamese restaurants in town don't extend past pho and some stir-fried rice dishes, and maybe a "clay pot" type dish if you're lucky.  This rice "crepe" will keep me coming back for more, yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. delicious crepe

t08iEkuWEhp0-ZGVCPfceQ.text: I've eaten here like 3 times already since i've moved from California. Living in cities like SD, LA, and the SF Bay Area where I would constantly find myself eating at Pho spots over a million times, I was a bit scared to see what Vegas would provide for my Pho cravings.  So far I've stumbled upon this place and the Pho is ok. The broth has the usual flavor, but I think I've had more flavorful broths eating in spots like Pho Ca Dao in San Diego and Jasmin Garden in San Francisco. But I will say the large bowl of Pho can hit the spot when you have the craving.  I have also had their wonton egg noodle soup. Pretty basic. Noodles have a soft texture and the wontons break a part easily--making it a pleasant experience eating together. I'm sad they didn't have the spicy chili oil sauce they have in some Vietnamese/Chinese spots.  Their fresh spring rolls are good as well.  In a way, I think their food is a tad bit over priced compared to some mom and pop Vietnamese restaurants I love going to in California, but ehh i'll get over it.   Another thing is that they have a limit of $10 when using credit cards. Since sometimes I usual eat by myself for dinner, it's kind of annoying.  So overall, the place is just OK in my book.

SOaeo3P6NaVj4WIGftX8aw.text: **CREDIT CARD FRAUD!***        CREDIT CARD FRAUD!  I am warning you to avoid this place completely.  I.D theft and credit card fraud is on the rise.  Don't let this happen to you.    Here's what happened.  My good friend paid for the lunch with his credit card.  This was the only transaction for the day on that specific card.  That evening he went to use it for dinner and the card was already shut down.  Come to find out, there were 4 transactions totaling about $800 originating from North Las Vegas while this restaurant is in Henderson (can't be at two places at the same time).  Praise the Lord that the credit card company caught the red flag and canceled his card and the investigation is pending.  I'm so bummed that this happened.  The food is great, the price is not bad and my wife and I were beginning to love  this place!  But in all seriousness and gravity, the good food is not worth the risk of having your identity and credit card stolen.  Be warned and be wise.  I care about all of you, who are reading this, and wouldn't want you to experience such a crime against you.  I implore you to stay away!  Have fun on your quest for good eats! Sincerely, Eric F.  p.s the Sunrise Cafe is great... it's on the north side of the same plaza a couple doors down from starbucks.

ahfHRP-oJlg-CP-MEEkrrw.text: This is the second closest Vietnamese restaurant to my locale, and is pretty much the only one I frequent if I'm close to home.  Good food, quick prep, normal service.  Vietnamese places aren't renowned for stellar customer service, guys - it's nothing personal.  =P  They recently raised the prices so don't use the online menu if placing a to-go order... Grab one inside on the counter.  That's what I did.  Their Thai tea is pretty darn good, surprisingly.  Sadly, no sauces included with noodle bowls... that's why I keep sriracha and hoisin at home.  #71 with a fried egg = nomz.

wRBVNhefY188IVUbdmRYcg.text: This is my fav location for pho in vegas and I've had it everywhere! They give you a lot of chicken they're fast and the flavor is the best pho around :)

a-PLYcgduRbB_-gaYHE7dg.text: YUM! This is by far our favorite Vietnamese / Pho restaurant in town! The service can be spotty but the food is always consistent and great! Plus, you cannot beat the prices. Both of us eat usually for under $20 even with an appetizer!  Our favorites  Crunchy Egg Rolls $5.95 Meatball / Beef Pho small $6.75 Sliced pork and grilled shrimp with virmecelli $6.75 Thai Iced Tea $2.25  This is a new location so it is pretty nice inside. It does, however, get pretty busy around meal times so plan ahead and come a little early to get a good table.   You won't be disappointed - that's Pho sure!

ztSUx9HMdtgLAXQ-FYFihg.text: Great motha phoken pho yo ! Eat here for some great pho and sexy paintings of Asian women. I wish I can take out me some pho too!

An8Nog3Jl17iuOYo9jPyOw.text: From the moment we walked in, we were told to seat ourselves at a table that was still dirty. The person that cleaned it didn't do such a hot job and never stocked the soup spoons or chopsticks. When we were seated the waitress came and took our order and within 5 minutes we had our pho. The pho was delicious, I can't complain about that but the service was awful. No one came to check on us throughout our meal, no one came to fill up our drinks or even give us napkins. We had to wait about 20 minutes to get someone's attention, when the guy came over I asked for two to-go containers and the check, the guy said ok and disappeared. Just to see him helping others and ignoring us....it was an additional 20 minutes until the waitress who helped us in the beginning came back and checked on us!!! Seriously!? She asked if we wanted water and if we were okay, an hour after she took our order...it's not a big place, it was a normal busy but come on! It's sad cause the food was good but customer service goes a long way.

HsqgjeUCJpgl4O8-3CvBAw.text: Best Pho in Vegas now that the big pho shop at Spring Mountain and Decatur closed.  I usually get chicken pho or the rare flank steak pho - it's kind of fun to get your bowl of pho full of rare beef and watch it finish cooking in the steaming broth.  I find the broth quite flavorful, but I also like to add squirts of lime, splash of rooster sauce, and sprigs of mint to kick it up a bit.  Even a "small" bowl will be plenty for you.  Noodles are plentiful and perfectly cooked.  Service can be a bit sparse, but it's gotten better.  Also, the pho gets to your table FAST - so there's not a lot of coming and going to interrupt your dinner conversation, reading, etc.  Pleasant little dining room.

Y1BsaBtECx_2KvoCOw2p2A.text: Rude ass mother fuckers here, if you like being treated like shit then you'll want to come here. Tried asking waitress questions about menu because it had been my first time & she acted like I was wasting her time. As well I ordered an ice tea, & never got it. Then they tried to bill me for that! The food isn't all that great either. I'm very upset with the way I was treated. They all need attitude checks. Litterarly felt like just because I was white they were rude as hell

XgEJjOYnf_dSTCb5RVFc8A.text: I am always pleased and quite full when I leave here.  Don't bother with Pho Mailan up the street, you can read my post about them as to why.  It's better than Lemongrass which is almost across the street. As for the people whose problem with this place is service....  In my not-so-humble opinion, crappy service is quite common in southeast Asian cuisine restaurants.  Many seem to lack any personality, and any server etiquette.  Same applies here.  But the food is consistently great and I've never been let down.

VAs64ahHTNjy3jWtxo72bg.text: Worst costumer service I've ever had. So rude. I can't believe people come here. I was afraid to ask for anything and when I finally did they walked away like they didn't hear me. Never coming back. The food was good but not worth the experience of being treated like that.

Ha1Y3nBNmYpbxivk1KLNZA.text: First off let me say that I rarely write one star reviews (check my other reviews on different restaurants) but I had to write this because of the HORRIBlE service that we received today! We ordered on the phone and they don't repeat your order back to you but when they get your order wrong, they claim that it's your fault. I am honestly not a difficult customer by any means but this place lacks any sort of customer service. We placed a simple order on the phone and repeated it to the lady multiple times.   When my bf arrived to pick up the order, the order was wrong. Instead of 59 it was 69 that they gave. The lady said, "this is what you got, what do you want? An add on?" And he was trying to explain that the order was wrong. They started raising their voices at him basically blaming him for their mistake. So they get him the correct order and the order looked half of what is normally served. They clearly were annoyed and didn't care. They're lucky that he already paid and tipped before noticing the error because they did not deserve the tip.   I completely understand that mistakes can happen but blaming the customer and raising their voices because THEY misunderstood is terrible business ethic. If they simply acknowledged their mistake and corrected it appropriately then all would be fine. This is not how to run a restaurant or any business for that matter. What a shame because I have family, friends, and co-workers that love pho but I would not recommend coming here to any of my friends and family any longer due to the terrible service. I'd recommend going to a different pho place, there's a ton in Vegas anyway.

BOwevnf1ULyzIiaD-oSRUw.text: I've been here several times. The staff is always friendly and your food is delivered in minutes. Great go to spot for a quick meal that hits the spot.

KYdRcEMqZiUOkb7eJOSUOQ.text: So this was the first time I've bought here, there's one in Texas that we love  so far the food we got was pretty good I must say but the only thing we didn't quite like were the spring rolls, they should use Roman lettuce for them or a better lettuce vs the iceberg lettuce. We will go back to them and try other dishes!!

VrN4eGzU3mp9iDfily9dsw.text: 2 stars because the Pho was really great but the service left so much to be desired that we will never eat here again.

1Ayk0FC_sH7MrHW5jteGXg.text: My family and I love this place. The ambiance could be better, but the speed of service and helpful happy staff make up for the decor. All the ingredients are super fresh.   We usually get the pho beefballs and lean beef, we also get the spring rolls. Yum!!! You won't regret you are here!!

0vPR9ChKBVwE3PneLiBw-A.text: Haven't had Pho in months.  The Pho restaurant by our home in Arkansas just vanished one day.  No Pho restaurants within 100 miles.  Saigon 8 is near a townhouse I'm renting.  It was excellent.  The sliced Brisket was very tender and the sirloin was sliced to perfection and very flavorful.  Lots of bean sprouts, basil, onion, etc to dress it up.  Service was very fast and the people behind the counter were very nice as well.  Wish I lived closer

twengu1K07igS2ifHeSIVQ.text: Hubby and brother-in-law wanted to eat Bun Bo Hue so we chose this place.  I've had it here before and it is quite decent.  However, this will be the last time I eat here.    Both hubby and BIL ordered the Bun Bo Hue Large and I ordered the small.  The bowls came out quickly and as they were finishing up their bowl, I finished almost 1/4 when I noticed a bug that looks similar to a rollie pollie in my bowl of soup.  I spooned it out, waved down our waiter, and at first glance, he said, "it's good.."  I said, "that's a bug in my soup."  He took the spoon with the bug and brought it back to the kitchen.  Moments later, another waitress that spoke fluent English came out to apologize and ask if i want anything else.  At that point, I am disgusted already so I said no and check please.    They took off the small bowl of Bun Bo Hue off of the check, but still charged for the bowls of the same soup that hubby and BIL ate.  We came to the conclusion that the bug must have been in the big pot of soup that they served to all customers as how else will the bug appear in the soup.  But nope, if they continued to charge us for the two bowls, we are sure they continued to serve that to other customers.    Very disappointed and will not return.

WPQJYaZwdX7vkWRNEWYSPQ.text: I've been here a few times before (years ago), and it was always good food and good service.   Most recently, I had dinner here a few nights ago. We got here around 6 or 7pm on a Monday, there was no wait, it was fairly busy, got seated immediately. But a few minutes after that, the dinner crowd started to roll in. We got there in good timing.   Interior still looks the same since I was last here. Nice, clean, asian decor.   I am currently on a Slow Carb Diet (protein, veggies, legumes...at least 20 grams of protein at each meal) to sugar detox and reclaim my health. That day I felt sick, so this was the perfect place to go to that night. My usual yelp habit is to look through the tips and then the reviews. I'm so glad I scanned the reviews because I read Mel C.'s review mentioning Pho with Chicken Breast! Thanks Mel! I scanned the menu at the table as well, and that was the best option for me. I've been to a couple of other Pho restaurants and that's the first time I saw Pho with Chicken Breast on the menu! I was excited.   There's a choice of a small or large bowl, I got the small. The small was a pretty good size, filled with more than enough noodles, broth and thick slices of chicken breast. There must have been 8-10 slices of chicken breast, which was more than I expected. Score! I can't imagine what the large would be.   I usually enjoy the noodles, but this time around because I was sick and have been cutting carbs my stomach didn't do well with the noodles. I ate a few, but they were too much for me. The noodles were pretty thick as well.  Next time, I'll have to ask for no noodles and replace them with veggies.   Oh by the way, you can also ask for egg noodles if you prefer. They had no problem switching to egg noodles with my friend's bowl.   Service was quick! Our food was brought to us in about 5 minutes.   Great service, no complaints and I will be back again!

QkZ168pa1gm4He7r9XU8gg.text: Always good pho ! Love their spring rolls. Good Char meats - beef, pork, chicken and pork chops. Fast friendly service. Would highly recommend .

tZbjr8vix8sNKqILHPcV6Q.text: I love the Pho here, always fresh and delicious. My favorite in Henderson. Friendly service too!!

BjCjbWV6xe7QlEAUE-WDRw.text: Horrible service!!! They said 10 minute wait for my party of 6, we waited almost 20 minutes when a party of 2 were seated. Continuing to wait another 10 minutes 4 people walk in and go to seat themselves. I explain to the hostess that they just cut us. Apparently, they were joining the previous party of 2. The hostess said that she was saving a bigger table for my party. I then explained to her the 2 people + 4 more =6. She continued to be passive and not tell the 4 people whom just walked in that we were next. This place is awful, no wonder why it only has 3 1/2 !

SfmctxThWpVpccdwjX0QIQ.text: First time I went here last month, I thought this place was okay. They gave me too much noodles in the soup that I was overwhelmed.   Second time, I LOVE IT.   My boyfriend got the Pho Tai (rare steak pho) and the broth was perfect. My grandma was impressed with how clear the broth was (listen to the old asian lady, they know what they are talking about when it comes to pho!). I liked how it was not too salty but still flavorful.  I got the Bo Luc Lac Rice (shaken beef). The beef was tender and they did not drown it in sauce like some places do. The lady  recommended steamed rice but I opted for their red rice (i think it's tomatoes that makes it red...but I am not sure). Next time, I will do the steamed rice.   Thai tea was amazing! Some places, the thai tea is too sweet. I can still taste the tea at this place.   Service was nice. I liked that they refilled my water so much. Great selection of food. Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ban xeo
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun cha ha noi. So yummy. The meat is so moist! Flavorful sauce.
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea! Perfect level of tea and sweetness!

26rTpl-yNU1ySc9Ge0q6Sg.text: I'm so irritated by this place. I was told about it by family and thought I would give it a try. I was sat promptly for just myself. I totally understand at these places especially for a party of one if your at a large table other party's are sat with you. The family that was sat at the same table had a young child with the loudest Ipad ever on. After five minutes and no servers coming by I got up and decided to order to go.  I ordered a chicken pho, egg rolls, a roll of French bread and Thai iced tea. When he told me the total I almost said never mind but I'm really hungry and craving soup. Fine f*** it I'll pay the !!!!!$21 dollar!!!!! bill. I've never paid so much for literally the same meal I get every time I go to a pho place. That's how much it usually costs for two meals!   So I sit down to wait....and wait......and wait. It's been 30 minutes from the time I ordered to go. I'm about ready to say never mind I want my money back. Me and another guy get up and are looking at the dude in the front like ughhhhh hello! He goes into the back and brings out 5 to go orders! Are you freaking kidding me?!?! So my order was just sitting back there?! When I ask for my Thai iced tea he grabs it out of the fridge with a bunch of melted ice in it. So that was probably sitting there for 30 minutes also. I got it home and it was just warm not hot like it should be. Egg rolls were soggy. Not crispy crunchy. So disappointed   Food was just ok. Not any better than any other place. Not terrible. Just whatever.   Also it was totally silent in there. Like no music. It was awkward no ambiance or vibe.   NEVER GOING HERE AGIAN. I should have just gone to a place I had been before.

B3INX8Ecq9dqHXJ8Y9CBnw.text: Came here for lunch the other day since I was on this side of town. I came with a bunch of friends and we got seated immediately.   I ordered a small pho with brisket & beef balls. My friends got a large pho (#18) & egg rolls. We got our rolls first and without really looking at the menu we assumed that spring rolls were the fried rolls, since a lot of Vietnamese places call spring rolls egg rolls & the uncooked rolls summer rolls. But I guess every Vietnamese place differs? (Kinda confusing tho :( ) we told them that we wanted the fried ones so they had to go back & make our order. At first they told us to just take it & eat them since we ordered it but why take something we won't eat right? The pho on the other hand was good. It had a lot of green onions which I personally like & the broth was flavorful. But my friends & I felt like the only difference with the large was more soup and a bit more meat. They didn't have a lot of noodles to accommodate the meat and I usually like that. My pho had a lot of noodles but not enough meat. I had about 4 beef balls cut in half (2 full size beef balls) & 4 pieces of brisket. I was left with a lot of noodles leftover. Pho 8/10 The egg rolls was good tho! 10/10  Customer service was decent. I feel like at a lot of Asian places customer service is just whatever. Not the friendliest but also not the meanest. A guy always came to refilled our water so +1 for them!   Overall, will come back here again to eat their pho! Especially because of th broth & how fast it was to receive your order.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small pho with brisket &amp; beef balls

qd3ys_DEEBrB-c4Nge5XXw.text: Pho broth clean, not oily, full flavored - beautiful broth.   Very generous with their meats in the pho - I couldn't even finish a small bowl. I got the combo with tendon, flank, eye of round, etc. What I love about their pho is that they aren't afraid to give you fat. A little fat on the meats is a wonderful thing, especially since the broth is so light.  Restaurant very clean and tidy.

5zUyECmkk21GoNX7XFZuvw.text: Wow Pho Saigon 8,  I am so disappointed in you guys.  How much cheaper can you get?  You raised your prices from 5.75 for a bowl of pho to now almost 9 dollars... and you still don't have enough to buy noodles and veggies?  This is the cheapest spring roll I have ever eaten!  There are maybe 5 strings of rice noodles in it, and nothing except chopped lettuce.... no other meat except shrimp that has been half cut.  I'm sorry but I have been a regular customer for several years and have seen it get worse and worse...  you have lost a customer.  Everyone,  don't expect quality anymore from this place.  Smh.... I am disappointed... and sad at the same time that quality of food has gone down the drain.....

EfDbip3Wo3V47s03td6ELQ.text: Pho Saigon 8 is alright. It's not bad but not amazing. It's right there dab in the middle It's like your usual pho place. It's located near 215 and S. Eastern near LVAC. Of the 3 or 4 other pho places in the area it's maybe my #2 or 3.  It shares the parking with a few businesses and it gets pretty busy during lunch so sometimes there aren't any parking right in front and you might have to park farther. Also getting in and out might take long.  When I come here I usually get the pho with everything except the meatballs and tripe, just not a fan of it. I think it's the #21 on the menu rare eye round steak, flank, brisket, soft tendon, skirt flank. All of that with the various veggie ingredients and sauces makes a good meal very tasty.  Services is usually good. It's cluttered near the entrance. Seat a good numbers of people. There's a sign that says $10 minimum for credit charges but noticed that they aren't always strict about that policy.   I don't always like eating here cause sometimes it doesn't feel so clean.

cjBzoIqBoHpVZFwlnrjp3w.text: I think this is the best Pho place I have eaten at so far in Vegas.  I had the #1 egg rolls, and the lettuce and herbs were fresh cold and crunchy, while the egg roll was hot and crispy, wrapping the egg roll in lettuce and herbs and dipping in the sweet fish sauce provided a wide variety of delicious flavors and textures.  I also had the # 24 beef Pho that had a great beef broth, a generous serving of noodles, and was unusually hearty for a serving of Pho, though I did get the large.  My companion had the #76 which was a combo of many different things in the Pho, she has had more Pho from many more places and she said it was great.  The service was a little below average, come for the food, not for the service.  That's why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars.  I had to ask for a refill of my water multiple times.

FR_xjjRkjzwb1QN40OSelw.text: So we went to take my sister for Pho for her birthday, and yes this was a highly recommended. We arrived and were told it would be a 10 minute wait for our party of six. About 25-30 minutes we watch them seat a party of 5 that came in after us. We spoke up before they were seated and the staff did not make it right, so we walked out with a very loud voiced opinion. We will NEVER I mean NEVER return and the business owners that recommended this place will be told. I'd also give less than a star if possible.

dch4HXMwBidoXuv4fZxIDA.text: When my parents first moved to Las Vegas, they asked the cashier at our pizza place (shout out to Eighth Avenue Pizza in Southern Highlands) where he goes for pho. He was Vietnamese and they assumed he would know where to go. He recommended this joint and that was 5 years ago. This has become one of our favorite places to eat out. Get past the language barrier. The menu (as I have photographed) has plenty of pictures with good descriptions of the food. We pretty much get the same thing everytime: 2 orders of spring rolls (they come 2/order); large pho #18, which has everything- rare eye of round, flank, brisket, tendon, & tripe; and #78, crispy egg noodles with stir-fried chicken, seafood. quail eggs, and vegetables. Sometimes, I order #61, grilled slice beef with rice vermicelli. The food comes out quick and is delicious. The wait staff is hit or miss, which is why I docked them a star. The prices are reasonable- pretty much everything is less than $10. The portions are large. We always end up bringing home our lunch and have it for dinner, too. For $1.85, you can order an extra portion of soup broth to add to the leftover pho. We always enjoy our lunch here. We go early, around 11, because they do get busy closer to noon.

y3h-kEXVqlApFbGqmXMMew.text: Ordered #70 Vermicelli noodles with shrimp, pork and egg roll. Portion of noodles/meat/veggies were pretty even all around. Cooked hot & fresh.  My dad ordered #35 soup. Not sure what it was but he said he really liked the taste of it. Tangy with lots of meat!

pB5ZKpCW3cl8C2J7lENX3g.text: Over the years I've come to appreciate Pho Saigon 8. It's not perfect but warrants higher than my previous two star rating. Went there for lunch today and the line was crazy long. Should've seen that coming on a cloudy/rainy day. Pho just seems to go so well on cloudy days, doesn't it?  I had the pho and damn I have to give it to them for their consistency. The flavor hasn't changed in years so you always know what you're getting. Your expectations will always be met. I didn't like the fact that the noodles were still pretty hard and had to sit in the broth for it to soften but it's not the end of the world.  The egg rolls are good and the peanut sauce is actually better than other places I've had it at. The service has gotten much, much better over the years. This is probably my pho spot on this side of town.

y6pD4jRt6d37y-C4k3N5Gw.text: So sad to say but unfortunately, I will no longer eat here...they were featured on dirty dining and had a bunch of demerits. That must explain the stomachache I had the last time I ate there??

7sZxjBdBpAQ1CIvzqBco8w.text: waiting in line to pay after eating is a huge waste of time. 5 stars for everything else. 1 star for wasting 5 min of our time

oV_Kgaa_Ad6INHVz0lvP5g.text: Gotta admit, saw this place on dirty dining but their food is soooo delicious!  I still go here regardless.  I love their pho as welll as their dry noodles. For the life of me, I can't think of the name of the dry noodles! Lol anyway, I also love their crispy egg rolls. So delicious and cheap!  Highly recommend!

iZx36Uifc8HVfeFZyEG23g.text: Wow!!! From my last review I talked about customer service being my only problem but ever since then, I came here 3 more times in 2 weeks and every single time was AMAZING customer service! Even the last time I came in today they were extremely busy yet greeted everyone and sat them right away! Service was so fast and attentive and everyone was so nice! This definitely adds the final star to complete my review! My favorite pho place of all time! Perfectly yummy and GREAT service now too!!!

BMkjpE7bVIld_6HdwMqQpg.text: First timers. Felt optimistic because it was packed, must be a good place right? We ordered egg rolls and halfway through saw a giant bug crawling around the lettuce. Bug in the food. Need I say more? If one is crawling around our food, imagine the kitchen. Couldn't get the feeling that I ate bug filled egg rolls out of my mind, total bummer.

eoOjtGeUcUJt38MeHAjGYQ.text: Ordered a take out easy to order over the phone. Price is somewhat fair. My only problem was that I only got 2 small pieces of tofu in my large vegetable and tofu pho.  Disappointed

eB_9kDkKVRYe8FZC0vAREA.text: Love this place, but they need to update their menu online. I based my order off of the prices online and when I went to go pay at the restaurant, there was a $20 difference. I was annoyed.

B2u1AoyhkPiE28RoR2IwoA.text: Will not be returning here, that's for dang sure. Our waiter (short, bald, Asian guy), was so f'n rude. He wanted us to order as soon as we sat down. I knew what I wanted, but my parents needed a minute to look at the menu. I told him we needed a minute and he walked away. What a mistake!! He took forever to come back to get our order. I had to get up and tell the girl behind the register that we were ready. When I turned back around, the same rude a$$ waiter returned back to our table. We placed our order with him and he didn't even repeat what we ordered, in fact, he didn't say one more word to us. When we got our pho, all our orders were wrong. We asked for extra beef balls in our pho and none of them had it. We also ordered shrimp fried rice with no vegetables and, it had vegetables. I called the waiter over and told him that our order was wrong. He yells out in another language to the girl behind the register, and she walks over. She asks if she could help us. I tell her that we ordered extra beef balls in our pho, and there weren't any. Also our fried rice had veggies, and we told the waiter, no veggies. She then asks if we wanted them to remake it. My Mom tells me in our language to just leave it, they might spit in the food. The bad service made us lose our appetites, and we barely ate our food, which was mediocre.

ufQ9bjEUKmAK9CmEOsChhA.text: I'd been wanting some Pho for some time and decided to stop one afternoon to kill my craving. The seating was a bit crowded, they were very busy and it was somewhat loud with the boisterous conversations but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Even though it was busy service was fast and efficient. I ordered the #44 Hu Tieu hay Mi Tom Cua (noodle soup with shrimp, crab and egg) and was not disappointed. I garnished it with the bean sprouts, basil and jalapeno along with some extra sauce to give it a bit more kick and paired it with some warm sake. I took my time enjoying the flavors as well as the atmosphere. I haven't tired many Vietnamese restaurants so I am by no means a  connoisseur but I will say I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #44 Hu Tieu hay Mi Tom Cua (noodle soup with shrimp, crab, egg)

PuqatNKxs054QYoZNyYeZQ.text: Located around the corner from Yogurtland with kind of a limited amount of parking is this wonderful place. Honestly I only get the bun bo hue here and it's a spicy beef noodle soup. It's perfect for a rainy cold day. It's not too spicy and they do offer chili oil to make it spicier if you'd like. My husband always gets just the reg pho tai which is just thinly sliced beef in a clear bone broth.  The give ample veggies (like bean sprouts, mint, basil and jalapenos) to add to your soup. So here's the big secret about Vietnamese soup....best hangover cure ever!!!! The noodles to absorb all the alcohol, the meat to fill your belly, and the natural oils from the broth to satisfy that need for greasy food with a healthier option!

C2zg7dbhWsu477bR5npEHA.text: I give this place a 5 star for its food!! Its service is a 3.5 on average lol  We first came to this spot since it was so close to home. It really kick started our pho love. We have tried other places and have now decided this is our spot!!! The broth is amazingly flavored. They give generous portions so if your not a big eater the small would fill you up.   Our meals consist of #13 beef broth with raw rib eye and flank, with a side of broccoli... Get it raw the broth is so hot that it will cook thw rib eye to perfection. #18 raw rib eye, flank, tendon, and tripe. We also start with #1 crispy egg rolls that come with generous lettuce and mint. Overall this place has the best Pho in Henderson!! No joke!   The service is spotty. However, we are willing to deal with it for the quality and freshness of the food. It is best to order everything you need before your server leaves to enter your order. Also, if you need a refill on your drink move your cup in eyes view they are ninjas when it comes to refills. We have never had a server be rude they are just usually pretty busy and they are there to get things done. It is very clean and it is not a place to lounge.   If you live in henderson and you are in need of some dank Pho this is a must try!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #18 beef broth with raw rib eye, flank, tendon, and tripe
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #13 beef broth with raw rib eye and flank
Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #1 Crispy Egg Rolls

JCmdTrCeI7jl6eppATRcDA.text: The people here are so nice and welcoming! My mother, sister, and I were seated right away. The broth was delicious and the cilantro and green onions added a amazing scent. Everything was cooked perfectly. I know I will be back!

66GDaKxogBxHbEVxUktFSg.text: Food is good but no service at all !  Do not dine-in if you do not  like  your dinner ruined by snotty and rude service.  Every one seems miserable. I reapeat everyone.   They forgot to bring my food out and when I asked I was  did you order at all ? hey my companion is half way through his I did not come to just sit and watch others eat their meals.   I had to ask for everything twice as the first no one seems to care or  pretended they do not understand ENGLISH.   When finally done I asked for my check and the waiter pointed  me to pay in the counter   using our table number.  I told the register why no one could  bring the check over and she rudely told me she could have brought it over if I asked her but hey why would I walk over all the  to the front just to ask register to bring my check.   After I paid she did not even gave me a receipt I had to ask for it.   WILL NEVER GO BACK - I WOULD LIKE TO BE TREATED LIKE A HUMAN WHEN I PAY FOR MY DINNER !

flSucMkaWR5S9s-6DOuU0g.text: This is the only place my wife will get pho. We have tried other places but she said they don't compare to a bowl you'll get here. I usually stick to a rice dish and a meat and recently had the pork plate with white rice and egg roll. I don't remember the number but it was a great portion for the price.  The service is hit and miss as you might not get a waiter back at the table after you've ordered.  Food comes out pretty fast especially if you have ordered the pho.

ZNCxzng2CtCjHEuw_E6RIg.text: It was empty when i entered which was odd because its right next to LV Athletic on easter. But it soon filled up. I ordered Rare Beef Pho and Spring Rolls and a Vietnamese Coffee all were on poi t and the pork in the spring roll wasnt gamey so i thoroughly enjoyed the whole meal. The staff is cool and they all pitch in to help which meant i wasnt waiting long for anything. The food got to the table lightning fast. Good place recommend it

KMwzvzriPBSptS97wHiqzg.text: Overall decent pho place, very flavorful broth with the lean steak/meatball pho. Quality of the meat was good and fresh accompaniments. One of the better pho options for the Henderson area. Service was decent, no complaints. Was just slightly disappointed when they got my to go order wrong when we were finished. 4/5

W5NLxFFPwg4It2RivLF4Jg.text: My go-to pho place in town! Pho Saigon 8 serves the best pho in the area hands down, and I've gone to quite a few of the other Vietnamese restaurants in town to find the perfect place. I'm from Orange County where there is some of the best pho restaurants you can find, so my standards were pretty high when I went on this search. Trust me when I say the best is here.   The wait staff is friendly and the food comes out super duper quick. They are always pretty busy but I have never had to wait for a table to be available.   The only fall back is that you are going be in close proximity to those around you, whether it be at your table or the table next to you. The tables feel kind of small and you have to be mindful when maneuvering around so you don't knock into other people... but this is a small price to pay! And speaking of price, the dishes are very affordable :)

91RrI5GY256mBYESXm7VEg.text: Yummy Pho for dinner is always yummy and healthy, no meat just noodle and soup with lots off green onions

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beans sprouts and mint to go in your pho.

TeSOk7D-CzpOE7OO--pj2A.text: I'm pretty obsessed with the Pho (beef) here. Thai tea is brewed near perfect and the Boba is always an added bonus.   The broth was clear,  and has a great flavor. I ALWAYS take a few spoons of broth and sip it before adding anything. I even have my kids doing it. You have to be able to taste it for what it is. If the broth can stand the taste test alone, then you known the bowl is worth the cost.  The plate full of basil, bean sprouts, lemon and jalapenos was plentiful, and super fresh.   My first time there, there was three of us. It was near lightening speed from when they took our pho orders to when the kitchen staff came out and delivered it to our tables. Seriously, I don't think even 3 minutes passed. Yay, for fast service!  The wait staff and cashier are bit lacking,  which is unfortunate. I asked the waiter for to-go bowls and waited far too long. Finally had to ask cashier, when son went to pay.  Our second trip,  the food and drink was just as good as the first time.  However, the lightening speed was gone, and actually felt we waited a longer time than normal. I will say it was packed on Sunday, so I understand.  All in all I love the Pho. I'm obsessed. I think about it all the time. If it weren't for Lent, I would be slurping it down right this very moment instead of writing this review.

R_MvmOzA5QpADhjVPKklgA.text: We came here on a weekday for lunch. The food is pretty decent but the service is where they're lacking most. Someone was seated a few minutes after us on a connected table and they took her order first and instead of taking ours immediately after, they left and came back.

4Pzz7sz6jbIHRBp57O-3FA.text: The pho is delicious, the place is causal and low key. ...The service, not so much. I waited at a table for a few mins, and one server kept avoiding eye contact. After I got my order, no one checked to see if I needed anything. And my dirty plates were not bussed and remained on the table until I left. Service 2.5 stars. Food 4 stars.

pBYlVVBy0L6xbjqI4fBLsg.text: Service is excellent, every time i come and eat with my fambam Lucy knows my order like usual !! Great people and very friendly !!

kteFaI7FMOTJcLeSNdwMYw.text: I have come here a few times. More so on my lunch break.  They prepare  everything fresh, it was always hot when I came to pick it up.   I have tried the spring rolls. Very good. Fresh shrimp, good peanut sauce. Also I have tired the egg rolls,they are the small ones minimally filled but have an great inside! I like how with the order you get a big bag of lettuce and things. The sauce for the rolls is also very good.  I should have tried more and gone more often, maybe I will.  But from what I did have , it was always good!

F3hjfidlXqsqjqbWO8EJFA.text: Ridiculous. I order a vermicelli half beef half pork. They said they couldn't do half beef and half pork for  an order so I requested that I pay extra for the other side of meat. The owner refused and say they were not willing to do it either I got pork vermicelli or beef vermicelli. They were not willing to accommodate me!!! When I was willing to pay extra. Horrible customer service and horrible accommodation for people that just want to have a meal and willing to pay extra for food that is not included in the original menu item. I was not trying to get comped or get free food I was trying to pay for what I wanted. It is ridiculous that this is the only place that does not do half beef half pork when all of the pho Vietnamese restaurants do it. Extremely ridiculous. The sever was rude and not welcoming at all. Will not be returning here ever again. Some restaurants need to realize that there is plenty of competition and other places are willing to not only have better food but better customer service. We live in Las Vegas, our industry is service, experience.... learn something from other places!

35ScP3yLSVT1aiPO5yeRMg.text: The pho is so good! The decor and feel of the restaurant was nice too. Servers were friendly. It was a nice experience for my first time here :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Saigon 8 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZUWX5Smrtd_e4YcvhOlaCA.text: Absolutely love their food here. I try to stop here each time I come into town. I Have tried many different options on the menu but, I keep going back to their beef pho. Service isn't the greatest, they take your order bring your drink and most times you don't get a refill unless you wave someone down. But the food makes up for it.

gjtY2rqRLRsfTNmszKpEVQ.text: Best pho place in town. I usually get the Pho Tai or the rice plate with the cubed beef. Their pho soup is really good. I'm not sure what makes their soup so much better then the other Vietnamese restaurants, but this place always hits the spot. Egg rolls and spring rolls taste very good here as well! I recommend going to this restaurant simply because the food is amazing. Customer service is above average as well. Unless they are full, they pretty much seat you right away.

9uawxX8duuZttwphieOv8g.text: Pretty decent Pho and rice dishes. The egg rolls are decent. The taste is consistent so we usually alternate btwn this pho place and another one way up the street.

zFSV3XGdPOo5xJXTDY5nSQ.text: I gave it 4 Stars because of the price of the bowl. I was there last Friday with 3 friends and we all ordered Pho. I ordered the #21 large with extra meatballs. It cost me $11.00. That's about $3-4 more than the other pho restaurants in Chinatown and it's much better in Chinatown. Okay, it was in Henderson but make it competitive. The meatball suck. It wasn't even good. 2 balls cut in half for $2.00 more? Wasn't worth the extra. They should have a combination bowl with everything in it. The broth was very good, egg rolls were good, and the spring rolls were good. I won't go back. I'm disappointed because they only had holson sauce, Sarachia sauce and a red chili sauce.

ilc7_14-1RO_W2OvrZb9iQ.text: My go to for Pho ! Great quality food + nice & fresh ! Best broth in my opinion. No AC last time I was there & it was unbearably hot inside. Table next to took food to go. That may have been a temporary thing I hope...

DolzkhBgyrO8z8EAnweFaA.text: Been going here for years and the food has been consistently good and service adequate with a few exceptions but I am moved to report today my pitiful experience. Fried egg rolls and beef pho the former came out small and burnt the latter didn't come at all. I ate the egg rolls and thought oh well but I was basically ignored while the wait staff entertained themselves. Decided to leave after 25 min. And I was one of only a handful of customers, not like they were busy you know.honestly the place has been in decline for some time now. Come on guys straighten up.

MPzJnEH7w4WcUqwNcb7EOQ.text: Korean noodles served up cheap and fast across from LVAC and BodyHeat. What more could you ask for? The perfect amount of spice in the BBQ pork meatballs and noodles, and if there isn't, there's always sriracha or chili paste.   This place has an enormous menu for the trying, but the first thing I wanted, they were out of. Credit card minimum of $10 so make sure to bring cash.

CU8y0DZw5ACwPgdSUXHcFg.text: Pho never fails at this location. Service is quick and prompt, although not very personable (but I don't set high expectations for that). Once ordered that pork chop with rice dish...it was really good although the portion was a bit small for the price. It was cut pretty thin and they only give you one slice. But other than that, the pho is better than most and it's usually our go to pho spot.

ntT5F0lEuy2kTjkNlEEL9w.text: This was my first time trying pho or Vietnamese food but it was delicious. I got pork broth pho with rice noodles and grilled pork and chicken. I think it was #47. I also had their spring rolls, which were amazing.   The only problem, one which makes me hesitant to return, was that I ended up sick the next day. Now, admittedly this could be a coincidence; but I can't recommend 5 stars when I ended up sick for 2 days.

OQpJRbleM1UGeAj2Qd0VvQ.text: I used to love this place. I've been here quite a few times over the past year or so. Quality has gone down and service always bad. I've yet to have my water refilled here, ever. You have to flag someone down if you want a to go box, extras, a napkin, anything. .. Sometimes I've been ignored. I went recently and the soup was cold, broth not as great as it's been and my meat looked old and had spots??? On it.... There was also something in identifiable in the soup. I always order the same kind so not sure what was up. I'm very disappointed and may just find a better place from now on.

_9ihEuga0aruFbfLrqicPg.text: This place is the bomb, we love their pho and fresh spring rolls.  If my kids eat their food, it must be good.

FLAXBtwIPJUIuybhXy5elA.text: Went here because Lemongrass Cafe was closed for remodeling... that place is our go-to, but my partner and I were really craving pho, so we reluctantly had to settle for another nearby place.  Been here once before, but wasn't much memorable back then. Felt the same way the second time around. We were immediately given menus and water, which was cool. Took a little while for someone to take our order though, but no biggie.  Lots of different meat options for the pho. But felt that the broth itself was almost flavorless. Perhaps because it was a freshly cooked batch and didn't have enough time to steep? Who knows. But the side of herbs of basil, sprouts, lime, and jalapenos were very fresh though.  Spring rolls were also big and plump and a filling appetizer for two people. Just wish it had been cut in half to make it easier to eat.  Service wasn't exactly warm, but adequate. Waters were refilled without having to ask. No one checked in on us at the end though or dropped off a check, so we just paid at the counter. (Not sure what the normal protocol was).   Fills the craving, but just made us miss our usual Lemongrass Cafe.

pLIPohE8cw9Xyq5EKbZdkw.text: I usually get one of their Pho noodle bowls.  I like the beef brisket, tendon, and also the beef stew noodles.  Meat is always very tender and soup is very flavorful.  I also like the spring rolls with the lettuce and cilantro wrap.  Sevice is a bit lacking, after the food arrives the next time they see you is payment on the check.  Last week went in and notice the prices have gone up across the board.  I guess a business can do that if they are busy all the time.

Pi1lTvjYeZLI7iC-Qvt-nA.text: Food tonight was not good --- bean sprouts brown, lettuce in wraps was brown also.  The lean meat soup was good.  The service in the restaurant has never been stellar but tonight the service was the topic of our conversation- we had to stand up to get someone to come to our table for a fork- water was never refilled and when we were ready to leave I wanted a to go box and not one person would come to the table. We just decided to leave. When I went to pay the check it was more $$ than I expected and because English is not that well spoken I asked for the receipt. To my surprise they charged a 15% tip--- for a party of 5!!!! It wouldn't have been questioned if the service was good!!!   Won't be back and I will for sure tell everyone I know!

l4lF8Uln8mNKguEVRI9N7w.text: First off I think the food is good. This is my go-to place when I want to have some pho around the area. My only concern is that the guy named Tran gave a really bad customer service. I mean that guy is not fit to be a server with the kind of attitude that he has. He's just flat out rude. He even rolled his eyes when we asked for straws and to go container. Who does that? With that being said, it just drives the customers away and think not to come back.. Not good for your business.

a5QI9dj-q25vM2AMs5FnSw.text: Fast review for a fast restaurant!   REALLY FAST FOOD! But good quality.  Veggie Pho has really good cooked veggies including Bok Choy. They are always friendly and have good service. Price is great and I know when I in a hurry I can still eat well. Please check them out!

GNh-NC-_ts4chb7nVK3toA.text: Love this place.  pho ! I may always get the same thing but it's always delicious lol

FsAjONehM40FR0wWvhPaHA.text: So yum. Always busy and service is good. Have only had spring rolls and Pho. Happy girl.

Q97umadlVDNEyUujfzwPew.text: Poor service in this resto. Wait staff looks like they don't want your business and cashier is texting. Food is decent just needs better service

hW4NlkluVLl01dW4qAzi_A.text: Served me cilantro, twice. I was very clear about my allergy to cilantro and could very well have ended up in the ER getting a shot. But because of my husbands good eyes the crisis was avoided.   Were they apologetic? No.   Remorseful? No.   Did they do anything to compensate? Only after pitching a fit was my meal comped. (which by the second send back I told them not to bother making again). Seriously?!? You want to charge me for a meal I sent back twice and did not eat a bite of? Bye!

wYTcrrNzVf_bfy-4SY0trQ.text: Fast and yummy...granted I usually just get the Pho, but I love it.  I can add as much or as little veggies and sauce as I want.   I go there ALOT (coffee is sooooooo good). I just love it!

yt5_yXOrpS8DNUtQcCpbLg.text: SUCH GOOD PHO! But the service and atmosphere sucks, so I only get take out. I get the #11 every time! So good.

1X5fO7xB3KVEPEi-fnaCJg.text: I want to first say that I really like the food here, but the service is less than mediocre.  And I know this isn't Joel Robuchon at the MGM, where the bussers scrape your bread crumbs off the table with a special bread crumb brush. But for heaven sakes, you are in the hospitality industry as well! I really don't feel their hospitality here! At least ask me if I would like some water? And even when you do ask me if I want water, it is as if you are angry for me coming into the place and having to actually make you work for your dollar! Or why do I have to flag you down whenever I need something?   As far as food, the spring rolls were decent, but nothing to honestly to rave about. The pho was not memorable, but I have had so much pho, maybe I don't know a good one anymore?  They have no sandwiches also .  The decor is maybe the best thing that they have going for them, and location.  I really dislike their tables though. I am 5'1 and very small, and I still think their tables are small! The problem is that the tables have this poorly placed bar under them where my husband kept pushing my legs.  Each table is so closely placed. I can almost hear every conversation around me. Not much of a place for a first date.   I love pho, but if there is another pho place at least a mile away from this one... I would choose the other, cause this place can really piss me off. They can be just darn rude here.

6cERC_fTxG9UFH9KoxX4Dw.text: I have a resolution to everyone's service complaints!! Order to go!  I placed an order for pickup after work... I've never done this with pho before, so when I went to pick up my ONE order of #11, pho tai, I was surprised to look like I ordered for an entire family!   I got home, unwrapped my goods.... it was just like I was at the restaurant, in my own home:]. Everything that they would serve you was included: all the leafy goodness (still not sure what all of it is), cilantro and chives, LOTS of noodles, and a generous amount of  RAW thin slices of beef. This was all neatly organized in a generic Styrofoam to-go box.  Hoisin sauce and red pepper sauce were also packed into my belongings. Also, a large Styrofoam cup/bowl(?) of the beef broth. The broth was still piping hot. It cooked my beef slices just as I wanted, instantly. Although I did make the mistake of keeping the lid off, so it cooled down pretty quickly and didn't cook the beef so well for my second portion.   Absolutely delicious.   I prepared it all just how I would want it.. and even came back for seconds. I of course didn't waste all the meat, but I couldn't finish the noodles.   It seems that people really knock the ratings down on this place because of the service... so may I recommend take out?? Try it again yallllll

H8j1lPB4GPG0wTgXGZi8pg.text: My wife and I were craving bun and our normal place Pho Mai Lan was closed for the evening. So we decided to go for it and give this place a shot.. Well.... It sure was a mistake! We walked in and they asked us how many. We told them two, and they walked us over to a table set down two glasses of water and walked away. Came back a minute later and set down two menus with our napkins on top, then walked away again. After about 5 minutes they come back over and ask us what we wanted. We hadn't decided just yet and we asked for another minute and the reply was, "Okay, just yell for me when your ready." And then she walked away.  Okay?! By now they've lost any chance at a tip. So after we decided to get #'s 69 and 70 we looked around and they came over took our order and about 10 minutes later our food came out! It looked good! Well!.... It wasn't. It was a HUGE disappointment! The shrimp on both plates were dry like last weeks left overs that they nuked for a minute and tossed in our dish. Our pork was a little on the burn side and had a funk nasty after taste, but it wasn't terrible enough to not eat... And my roll was fairly uncomfortable to eat. We'd have to say the worst part was the fish sauce. That wasn't to great.  So while we ate the atmosphere wasn't very inviting. The wait staff was talking on their phones while they were on speaker so we could hear all of their conversation. It was also not very welcoming when they would look at us hoping we would leave.  All in all everything was terrible except their pricing was pretty fair.

-Nwu_4a7grMAOyx-rAN_hA.text: Fast service, always fresh food. Great value. I have a preference for the #15 Pho Tai Bo Vien. Noodle soup with rare eye round steak and beef meatballs. Not a salty broth like some Phos sometimes come.

H7rx4s2kRFvz8N3TjA-xsA.text: Felt like another run of the mill Pho spots that's on any other corner. I ordered the #11 because I just like it simple sometimes with just the beef in my pho. The table we got sat to had a strong scent of mildew. Maybe it's from the rags they keep using.. but that's just a guess so it could be something else.   The Pho tasted okay so I will give it 4 stars.. but didn't really make me scream wow. The noodle was cooked well.   The place is a little cramped so make sure you don't bump into anybody on the way in and out.

vnFdySCS9Pw8zNBBdsHXgw.text: This was the first time I've ever had pho, I had number 46 with egg noddles. It was so good!! I ordered to go and service was fast and friendly. Would come back again soon.

jW-5RABH07By6qUvvZxExw.text: If you are not eating here and live on the south end of town then you are cheating yourself out of one of life's best pleasures.

P1T4jg8l2D-bfPrrUdNpPw.text: This place is has the best PHO in Henderson. Definitely a regular

KU02ia40ehH0dYs8aMJ0xw.text: Came here for a quick Pho fix. It was a decent place easy location to find. The inside is clean looking , the tables are too close together. The staff was not the friendliest either. The food: was okay. The pho was decent but it was missing something the flavor was not there. They had a piece of tendon in there literally bigger then my debit card. We also had the vietnames rice noodles with shrimp and pork. For some reason they gave us that to go. So I believe this took away from the experience of how its to be eaten. The egg roll was not cut instead whole which is not how I've seen this plate served. The flavor was a bit bland the shrimp were over cooked.
